placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We stayed on the ground floor, in the Tangerine Suite
text: We spent a lovely 5 days here in July.  Everything was perfect- plentiful and delicious food, beautifully landscaped grounds, lovely old fashioned rooms and lovely people.  Ranjan, the manager, was such a nice, genuine person.  They arranged a driver to take us on a four day trip to the cultural triangle after we left them, and he was pleasant and responsible.  Please ignore the one bad TA review- every point the reviewer makes is false.  It wasn’t noisy; we did hear the train occasionally but that only added to the atmosphere.  The rooms were spacious, even with the extra bed for our son.  The bathroom was lovely, and had an open-air feel to it.  The beds were very comfortable, the lounge furniture nice, etc.  Don’t hesitate to book- it will be the most memorable place you stay at in Sri Lanka!  Of all the places we stayed in in our three weeks there, including Galle Face in Colombo and Kandalama, Max Wadiya is the one which we have fondest memories of.
title: Perfect!

placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka
text: Max Wadiya was a dream come true!  My friend and I loved staying at this stunning tropical hotel, which offers comfortable rooms decorated beautifully in local style right on a secluded beach.  The bathroom was modern and luxurious, showering under an open roof using eco friendly products.  The relatively small size of the hotel creates an intimate atmosphere, and Ranjan and his staff treated us like family.  We were served delicious Sri Lankan tea and gourmet meals in the lush garden overlooking the ocean.  My friend and I also got to help the hotel further its conservation mission by releasing rescued baby turtles into the ocean at sunset.  The hotel is also not far from the old Galle fort, which made for a lovely day trip.  I highly recommend staying at this paradise!
title: Welcome to paradise

placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka

they say a picture is worth a thousand words 
heartfelt thanks to Ruth Ranjan & Team (not forgetting nibbles the mascot dog) they went over and above their normal routines to make me feel safe happy relaxed , I will never forget my stay there,

placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived after our long road trip from Ella we were very well looked after by Ranjan and his team. 
We stayed in the villa as a family, rooms were traditionally furnished and very clean with air conditioning and views onto sea and beach. We all loved the saltwater pool, the grounds and garden were beautiful and well maintained.  
The hospitality Ranjan and his team gave us was attentive without being too much, we loved all the traditional home cooked sri lankan curries, best we've ever had. It wasn't any bother to accommodate the children with a variation of food. Every meal was served with pride and had obviously been lovingly prepared. 
Ranjan organised all our local excursions which we thoroughly enjoyed. We'll be back In the future can highly recommend!
title: Sri Lankan beach stay

placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka
text:
Max Wadiya is a corner of paradise - a glorious welcome, exquisite food, a spacious room just a stroll through the tropical garden onto a sandy beach of the Indian Ocean. My wife and I spent 3 days here in March - and at night we dined under the stars, listening to the waves and watching the fireflies dance in the breeze along the beach. What could be better? 
... Our best surprise was to be woken our first day before 7 a.m.by Ranjan, the hotel manager, to be told the turtles were hatching from eggs buried in the sand as part of a conservation project. And there they were - dozens of tiny creatures waving their tiny flippers as they dug their way up and blinked the grains of sand off their eyes. We scooped them up into a big blue plastic tub filled with water and later helped Ranjan release them at sunset on the beach - giving them a chance to swim to deeper waters overnight. 
But that was just an extra - Ranjan and his team made us feel welcome throughout.
They made some of the best curries ever - with ingredients we'd never tasted - straight from the local vegetable and fish markets.
Max Wadiya was the highlight of a 10-day trip to Sri Lanka. And if there's a Tripadvisor competition for the most charming manager Ranjan gets our vote.

Thanks Ruth, Art, Ranjan and team - We'll be back!
title: Amazing welcome, turtles hatching

ownerResponse/text: We are so pleased the wedding reception went well – we would almost say flawlessly. It’s also true that luck was on our side, both with the weather and with the fact that the wedding party could participate in the release of turtle hatchings on two consecutive nights. We enjoyed working with you in the planning, and were as anxious as you that the celebration be as perfect as possible since this was our first wedding. Thank you for your complementary review, and we wish you a long and happy life together.

text:
We spent 5 days in the Max Wadiya for our wedding and what a special moment it was! Ranjan and all of the staff have made those few days a dream :) From the preparation to the actual reception (which lasted 2 whole days) they were nothing but the best. Attentive and considerate they made everyone feel at home. Our parents, but also our 40 guests, have spent a beautiful moment in the luxuriant garden of the Max Wadiya. And I want to highlight how amazing the food was: a lot of our guests told us this is the best food they had had in Sri Lanka! 
I would definitely recommend renting the entire villa for a relaxing stay between the pool, the garden and the peaceful beach. My only comment would be that the noise from the street is pretty loud, and becomes disturbing at night when trying to go to sleep. A better soundproofing, with a new AC, would make it a true paradise.
Thanks again to all of the staff who made our wedding such a special moment.
title: Exquisite service!

placeInfo/address: 147, Galle road Madampe, Ambalangoda 0351 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The villa, with three double bedrooms, is great for families or groups, while the two suites are perfect for couples.
text:
We just enjoyed eight days in paradise on our third (!) visit to Max Wadiya. Every part of every stay has been a delight. And as always, putting our trust in Ranjan, the manager, to find the best raw materials available at the market on any given day paid off with one memorable dinner feast after another (all inclusive, by the way). 

Rather that repeating the praise that we, and others, routinely heap upon Max Wadiya, Ranjan and the crew, this time around we’d like to mention some of the other reasons we love to stay there.

The local town, Ambalangoda, is not (yet) overrun by tourists, unlike popular Hikkaduwa, just 15-20 minutes away by Tuk-Tuk. That means you can get whatever tourist services you need in Hikkaduwa, and then retreat to the unsullied charm of Ambalangoda.

On the beautiful beach right outside Max Wadiya’s lush and lovely grounds and infinity pool, you’re more likely to meet Sri Lankan fishermen at work or local kids playing volleyball than encounter another tourist. Join Ranjan for a trip to the local market, and you’ll see, hear and feel the real Sri Lanka. He also offers Sri Lankan cooking classes in the kitchen … at no extra charge.

Plus, there are such local attractions as the Ariyapala Mask Museum, Dudley Silva Batiks and the lovely Sri Vijayarama Viharaya Buddhist temple. Don’t miss the Community Tsunami Museum in Hikkaduwa about the 2004 tsunami that devastated much of the area. It almost moved us to tears. 

Max Wadiya is also an excellent base for day trips, and is only a couple hours (depending on traffic) from the Colombo airport.

On top of that, the hotel and its owners fund and run a sea turtle hatchery on the property. They buy up eggs from local fishermen to incubate in the sand and then point the hatchlings of these highly endangered species toward the nearby sea. Part of our daily tradition at Max Wadiya is the check out the hatchery in hopes of seeing newborn giant Green and Olive Ridley turtles

It’s not just Ranjan and his crew that make the place so special. It also everyone connected to it, from the Tuk-Tuk and car drivers they use to their regular masseur, who comes to their purpose-build massage pavilion upon request. 

Every time we arrive, we feel like we’re coming home.
title: Third visit and just as charmed!

placeInfo/address: Temple Road, Beliatta 82200 Sri Lanka
text: The villa of Maya Tangalle is simply a heaven on earth. I spent several days there and was welcomed as a queen by the kind and devoted staff. The houses and their decoration, the luxuriant park full of old trees and wonderful flowers, the birds chirping around within each thicket, the royal-blue swimming pool, the home-made delicious food cooked by the Chef. In the morning, I could not wait to enjoy the copious and tasty breakfast, sitting in the sun or under a majestic tree... Yes, everything is there to make you feel over the moon. I would particularly remember Prashanth's thoughtfulness and professionalism who, as a Head of staff, made everything he could to make me feel good. As a naturalist, I was also very touched by the staff's sensitivity and very happy to see that our discussions bear fruit: One day, a nestling fell into the swimming pool and I saved him in extremis. After I explained to the staff, he would fall again and most probably die if we did not move the nest further away from the water, everyone swung into action and moved the very heavy stone flower pot further into the park. On my advice, they even set up wind chimes around the swimming pool later on, in order to keep birds away and prevent them from drowning. I also know what the Villa leads environmental projects, among other things by planting trees. I was for that matter very lucky to plant a banana tree that I hope will grow strong and high in this magical place. And I am sure that I'll come back again one day to see that with my own eyes.
title: What more could we ask for ? Maya Tangalle Villa, a piece of heaven

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Wsamc,

Thank you for taking the time to share your enchanting experience at Maya Tangalle! We are delighted to hear that your stay with us was a dream come true and that Prashath and our team exceeded your expectations to make it the most incredible experience for your first visit to Sri Lanka.

It warms our hearts to know that you enjoyed the tailor-made tours to various attractions, from the Mulkirigala Rock Temple to the beautiful beaches of Tangalle, Udawalawe National Park, Kalemetiya, Handunogoda Tea Plantation, and the Galle Fort tour. We strive to provide our guests with a diverse and enriching exploration of the region, and we are thrilled that you appreciated the experiences we curated for you.

Chef Ashoka and his team are delighted to hear that you found the food to be unreal and that they were able to offer you an authentic Sri Lankan culinary experience every day. The outdoor cooking class was a special touch, and we are pleased it added to the overall enjoyment of your stay.

Your kind words about Sampath and the serving team are truly appreciated. We take great pride in providing exceptional service in a peaceful setting, and it's wonderful to hear that our team's efforts, from table arrangements to their friendliness, contributed to your memorable experience.

Maya Tangalle Team
placeInfo/address: Temple Road, Beliatta 82200 Sri Lanka
text:
Maya Tangalle is an absolute dream. Prashath and his team went above and beyond to make our 4  nights at Maya the most incredible experience for our first time in Sri Lanka. They will tailor your trip to exactly what you are after. We opted to  get out and about going on multiple tours: 
- Mulkirigala Rock Temple - amazing buddhist cave paintings and statues
- Exploring the beautiful nearby beaches of Tangalle 
- Udawalawe national park - elephants galore
- Kalemetiya - bird watching with excellent guides
- Handunogoda Tea Plantation - fantastic information on tea making and a beautiful place
- Galle day trip with a Galle Fort tour

 The food that was cooked for us by Chef Ashoka and his team was unreal. An authentic Sri Lankan food experience is exactly what we were after and we got it every single day. They even put on an amazing outdoor cooking class for us.

If you are looking for exceptional service, in a peaceful setting then Maya Tangalle is for you. Sampath and the team of servers go out of their way to set up beautiful table arrangements around the property and they are the most friendly people! 

We will be back again. This place is truly special.
title: Maya Tangalle: heaven on earth

text:
Maya Tangelle is the most idilic place to stay.  We stayed here for 1 night as part for  little trip around Sri Lanka on our honeymoon and wow did the team here go the extra mile.  
We were the only guests and never felt like we were an inconvenience.  The location is beautiful and very private, the team are wonderful, so attentive and kind.  

The food was amazing we were lucky enough to have a BBQ outside where we had lots of different fish and meat cooked right in front of us lit up by a nearby bonfire it was the most romantic dinner.  

We stayed in the presidential suite which was second to none, the colonial interior shone through in the finishing touches to the decor.  We had massages on our own private terrace and afternoon tea by the pool.

On leaving we were surprised by a tea plant ceremony which really made our stay here feel special.  

Id recommend staying here and would defiantly come back.  A real touch of boutique luxury.

text: At Maya Tangalle, elegance meets the soulful charm of Sri Lanka. The menu offers a harmonious blend of international and local delights, showcasing the diverse culinary heritage of the island. placeInfo/address: Temple Road, Beliatta 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Tranquility, creative cuisine and first class service defined our stay here. On arrival at this discrete unmarked property the gates opened up to reveal a charming villa with a neat garden and a variety of  specimen trees.  The Resident Manager put us at ease immediately and during our stay his excellent team of staff took care to note our personal needs and attended to them diligently with an appropriate balance of respect and informality. I loved waking up to bathe in the pool and enjoy being served bed-tea there, overlooking the restful vista of paddy fields.  The innovative chef delighted our eyes and palate whilst catering for our particular food allergies. There are only five rooms so I can’t imagine it’s ever crowded but we were fortunate enough to enjoy our second night with the place to ourselves which compensated for the spacious  lounge being unavailable to us for the first day. The rooms vary considerably with the suite being the largest and most opulent in every aspect.
title: Tranquil elegance

placeInfo/address: Temple Road, Beliatta 82200 Sri Lanka
text: Maya Tangalle is more than just a dining destination; it's a journey through Sri Lanka's vibrant past and promising future. The ambiance exudes old-world charm, while the menu showcases a diverse array of dishes that cater to both local palates and international tastes. A must-visit for those seeking a genuine Sri Lankan experience.
title: Sri Lankan Splendor with a Modern Twist

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: One of the best places we've ever stayed and definitely the best in Sri Lanka by far. My husband and I absolutely loved everything about this paradise and the owners are wonderful people willing to help with everything you need. The accommodation is spotless and so comfortable, the beach is beach and clean and the food is absolutely next level. The chef is a master! I would recommend everyone to go if you travel to Sri Lanka, you will absolutely not be disappointed with this corner of perfection. I wish we could have stayed forever.
title: Absolute paradise, you'll want to stay forever!

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
If you’re looking for an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of your everyday life, Whiskey Point Resort is it. The service was amazing (special shout out to Mufa- no request was too difficult and he always had a big smile!). 

The hospitality from Nicola and Anna was kind and they both go above and beyond to make sure you’re having a great time. Nicola has plenty of local knowledge to help with whatever questions you may have and can organise anything for you. 

The rooms were very clean and serviced daily. We stayed in the upper cabana and sitting on the deck on in the hammock having a cold beer each afternoon was exactly what I wanted for my holiday! 

The pizzas and pastas are a MUST try whilst you’re here (Nicola is Italian and he really knows good pizza and pasta!!) and if you give the chef previous notice, he was more than happy to cook some local Sri Lankan cuisines for us! Not to mention, breakfast each morning with a fresh juice always set us up for a good day!!

Anna is a fantastic yoga teacher and we loved getting up early, listening to the birds whilst enjoying a great yoga session! The beach is literally on your door step, and we went swimming in the ocean daily. 

Whiskey Bay Resort was a real highlight for our holiday and I’d id recommend it to everyone considering staying here!
title: Best place from our whole Sri Lankan trip!

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
5-☆ Rating from the booking till checkout. Nicola and Anna are the perfect hosts. They take care of you from the moment you arrive. And his workers are just as helpful. We’ll trained boys!
Cabanas are simple, comfortable and clean. A wonderful experience. Food is delicious and the best coffee in Sri lanka. We made use of safari tours, surf lessons and yoga. The beach is beautiful and was not crowded. It was well worth the 7hr journey from West to East. Thank you guys!!!
title: A ressort run with a lot of passion

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: Want to experience paradise? This is the closest thing. We have been traveling through Sri Lanka, and this is by far the most beautiful place we have seen. Perfect italian cuisine, prestine beach 10 meters from where you are sleeping, and a worldclass righthand surf break makes this place almost too good to be true. Nicola the italian owner will make sure that you have the best experience possible. Highly recommended!
title: Paradise

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed with a friend during the low season. The hotel was well maintained, with daily garden and cleaning maintenance.
The Italian cuisine they serve there is of excellent quality. It felt nice eating something so authentic italian in Sri Lanka. You can tell and taste the owner is passionate about it.
The rooms are very well done and a pleasure to walk into and stay in.
10/10 would go again.
title: Beautiful location. Excellent atmosphere.

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
If someone asked me what my paradise would look like I would just describe this place. It is the perfect place to collect yourself and rewind for a couple of days. Nikola (the manager) and Anna went out of their way to make our stay as close to perfect as possible. Despite the current situation in Sri Lanka (lack of fuel) they managed to arrange an airport pickup in Colombo and we got safely to the resort without too much hassel. They are both warm and genuine people who generate so much good energy that it is impossible not too fall in love with this place.

The place in itself is like a little oasis located on the beach. Our room was lovely and cozy, even though it didn't have AC the sea breeze along with the fan makes it cool and tempered at night. The food and drinks are simply amazing. Make sure you try some of their fresh smoothies while you are there, you won't regret it. If you like to surf you can just ask them to rent a board and you can take a 10 minute walk along the beach to Pottuvil Point. If there is a good swell this spot provides you with the longest waves in the area! All in all if your planning to go to Sri Lanka and more specifically the east coast I would highly recommend to stay at least a couple of days at Whisky Point Resort!
title: Secluded paradise!

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
Whisky Point will definitely be one of our favourite spots in Sri Lanka. They have an amazing coconut garden just in front of the beach, and beautiful wood cabins with the best beds and pillows we’ve had in the country.

The place is super peaceful and has really cool vibes.

Nicola, the manager, and the team, treated us like family and they took care of everything, supporting us in every single way possible. 

Huge mention to the italian food and the hammocks. We had the best nap ever!!

We really recommend this place!!
title: Felt like home

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
Comfortable, clean, friendly and stunning. 
Our stay here was magic. 
Nicola and Anna are amazing hosts that share their love of paradise with you. The beach huts are so wonderful and romantic if that's what you're after. Highly recommended!
title: Fabulous all round

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: There is not a better place to get authentic Italian food in Sri Lanka. The owner is incredible and Italian, thus, holding his food to the authentic standards it truely deserves. Hitting the mark for perfection by every metric. The atmosphere is incredible, the lighting, the perfectly placed palm trees and surf lapping the beach. A patch of heaven in Sri Lanka! Myself and my fiance had and amazing lasagna, perfectly seasoned and rich, topping it all off with real parmesan cheese and bread with real olive oil. The large portions are plentiful and the whole experience is topped off with amazing service from the waiters. For desert I had a rich chocolate brownie and ice cream, my fiance had passionfruit and coconut panna cotta. Both of which were to die for and perfect for finishing of an incredible main course.  To indulge in the only authentic Italian ingredients, cooking and atmosperic experience on the east coast whisky point resort is a must try. Thank-you for the incredible food and evening
title: Incredible in every way

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
We stumbled on this place after searching for somewhere to relax from the hustle and bustle of the streets of Arugam  Bay and could not have wished for a more relaxing place to stay. 
After a chat with Nico at the lovely open bar area, we checked out of the place we had booked for 5 nights in Arugam Bay and came back here the next day. 
Our first night was in a lovely Pagoda and our first morning waking up to the sun and the breeze and the birds was nothing less than perfect! 
We moved to a cabana for the next few nights and it was so lovely we extended our stay for a few more nights just as everyone else staying there seemed to have done! 

Anna and Nico were the perfect hosts and put so much hard work and passion into making the place clean, comfortable and homely. I could have eaten their amazing Italian food all day every day. 

Anna and Nico were always present for any advice and just for nice chats and games! Anna organised a safari for a group of us and a lovely walk to the most amazing views of Yala. We did an aerial yoga class with Anna which was so lovely in the Shala.
The staff worked super hard to keep the place pristine.
We're so happy to have found this place and would have stayed a lot longer if we could. I'd 100% recommend this place for pure relaxation. The beach was practically empty and so clean. Barely any rubbish as on other beaches we visited in Sri Lanka. 

Thank you so much Nico and Anna and I hope the 2 kittens Anna saved are ok!

A&A
title: Perfect relaxation

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try the Ravioli
text:
Whisky Point Resort was a wonderful starting place for our holiday. It’s a short tuktuk ride outside of busy Arugam Bay in a green & safe surrounding directly by the beach. 
Very comfortable beds, the sound of the ocean, direct surf access, great food at the restaurant and super helpful & friendly hosts made us extend our stay twice. 
Will definitely come back.
title: Perfect beach holidays.

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
By far the best place we’ve seen in the area of Arugam Bay in an idillic and peaceful surrounding. We loved the resort, its beautiful garden full off flowers and palm trees and little wooden houses. The owners very well take care of their guests, the place, and the nature around. Our apartment was on the second floor with a spacious wooden balcony where we could sit, read and enjoy the nature. The rooms are very clean and our bed was extremely cozy - we slept like baby’s in the fresh breeze coming from the ocean. 

The whiskey resort quickly felt like family. Nikola and Anna are wonderful and most caring hosts, always there to help and to provide their guests with a good time. We loved spending time with them in the cafe / restaurant where we often chilled, drank coffee, played or just chatted. Btw, the coffee tastes really good! Given Nikola’s Italian roots, the menu in the restaurant offers a delightful blend of Italian food (the past is just perfectly aldente :)) They further inspired us to do some day trips together with them, going to the elephant rock and doing a safari which were both wonderful nature experiences. After our time at whiskey point resort, we went to the south but very quickly started to miss it — we did not find a comparable place shaped by such good vibes, nice people and beautiful unpolluted nature.
title: Wonderful Idyll

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: Ana and Nico made us feel very welcome and we spent most days chilling at Whisky Point in their shaded, breezy, beach-side spot. We enjoyed their authentic Italian menu, coffee and fresh juices. The beach at Whisky Point is pristine, peaceful and has great surf when in season. We felt very safe on our trip and our time was not affected by the current crisis in Sri Lanka. 100% recommend a visit to Whisky Point.
title: Beautiful beach side resort with friendly, chill vibes.

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
Such a wonderful stay!
We spent 3 nights here as part of our 3 week travelling around Sri Lanka. I booked on the basis of the wonderful reviews I had read and the place exceeded our expectations.

Nico and Anna are the most lovely hosts and go above and beyond to make your stay a memorable one. 

We stayed in a cabana which was simple but beautiful and kept immaculately clean. Lovely touches such as the hammock on the front balcony.

The food was delicious as were the fruit juices and milkshakes.

The resort is around 10/15 minutes out of Arugam Bay and set on a beautiful clean beach which we practically had to ourselves on most days. The sunrises and sunsets were stunning.

I tried the swing yoga with Anna in the morning- such fun and sets you up for the day. She also organised a jeep trip to Elephant Rock to watch the sunset and it was a lovely opportunity to chat to some of the other guests.

Would definitely recommend this place if you want to feel totally relaxed and looked after. Definitely felt like a home from home and we would stay again should we ever revisit Sri Lanka.

Thank you Nico and Anna and all the luck for the future.
title: A little piece of paradise

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: Amazing location, great food, magical beach and wonderful host. Slept in the pagoda it was magical to wake up with this ocean view. Best place in Sri Lanka, felt at home from the very beginning. Thanks for everything Nico!
title: Best place in Sri Lanka, thanks for everything Nico!

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and every single second was worth it. The food was so delicious , the service was top. All we needed Nico and Anna made sure we had it. We met great people with whom we spent great evenings with. Anna took us on a safari and a temple on a hill with a great view. The surfing spot is really good.
So yes, I am definitely coming back as soon as s I have the chance and of course I will  spent more time there.
You will not regret your visit. Back your bags and go!
title: Definitely coming back!

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text:
A great place to stay as a couple or with friends. 
Very warm welcome by the owner and personel. Great surfing spot if you are into it. Food is absolutely awesome and beach is 30 seconds away. They also organised a safari for us which was great. 6 out of  5.
title: A little paradise in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for a wonderful stay.  I hope we come back there someday.  You have a beautiful hotel and the surroundings of the hotel.  Perfect rooms and clean.  Tasty meal.  It is a paradise in Sri Lanka.  Staff still nice, helpful and friendly.  They will provide you with everything from arrival to departure. You don't have to worry.  Thank you Nicola and Anna
title: Thanks . Robert

placeInfo/address: Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka
text: I stayed at Whisky point as a part of my level 1 hotel quarantine. And I couldn’t be happier! The location right on the beach with whiskey point surf break within strolling distance was a dream. Falling asleep to the sound of the waves in the beautiful cabanas is really something incredible for the soul! But what made my stay most memorable were the staff and owner! Food was fantastic and I just can’t thank Nichola and his partner Anna enough such a hospitable stay. Nichola true to his Italian spirit was so passionate about every thing he did. He truely went above and beyond to ensure my stay was perfect. Even after my stay he was always there to help out with any questions on Sri Lanka and my travels. There is so much to love about Whisky point I can’t recommend it enough!
title: Something special

placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you want dinner at the property book it in early with the chef.
text:
Staying at Sergeant House was one of the highlights of our trip to Sri Lanka. Tucked just a short walk from the centre of Unawatuna, the property felt like a peaceful, private oasis — full of charm, history, and natural beauty.

We were lucky enough to be the only guests during our stay, and the experience felt incredibly personal and exclusive. The private beach just across the road was a lovely, quiet spot — a beautiful place to relax and take in the ocean views.

The staff were absolutely wonderful. They truly spoiled us – always warm, attentive, and thoughtful without being intrusive. Every interaction felt genuine, and nothing was ever too much trouble. It was clear they take great pride in making guests feel at home.

The villa and gardens are beautifully maintained, with colonial architecture and lush greenery. We had the pool entirely to ourselves throughout our stay, which made it feel all the more relaxing and luxurious. Our room was spacious, tastefully decorated, and very comfortable — a lovely mix of heritage and modern touches.

Breakfasts were generous and delicious, with fresh, flavourful options that started each day beautifully.

Sergeant House is a rare find — peaceful, full of character, and run with true care. It was the perfect place to slow down and enjoy the quiet, and we’ll always remember the calm and kindness we experienced here.
title: Serene, Stylish, and Full of Heart – A Special Stay at Sergeant House

ownerResponse/text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review of your stay at Sergeant House and I am delighted that you enjoyed yourselves so much.

Thank you for coming to stay and hopefully we will see you again!

With best wishes

Chathuri Edirisinghe
placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
**Sergeant Hotel, Unawatuna – A Tropical Whisper in the Heart of Sri Lanka**

Nestled among lush tropical plants, the **Sergeant Hotel** in Unawatuna is a true sanctuary of high quality and refined aesthetics. A peaceful retreat where nature and architecture blend seamlessly, offering an atmosphere of effortless luxury and serenity.

The swimming pool area is like a private oasis, surrounded by greenery and bathed in soft sunlight. Comfortable loungers invite you to relax for hours, while the calm waters reflect the blue skies and the tropical leaves dancing above.

The rooms are beautifully decorated, combining colonial elegance with modern comfort. The four-poster bed, framed by a delicate mosquito net, creates a romantic and cozy atmosphere. Every detail — from the handcrafted carpets to the tasteful furniture — reflects care, quality, and a genuine sense of place.

Outdoor sitting areas allow for tranquil moments with a coffee or a cocktail, embraced by the sounds of nature. Everything feels intimate, relaxed, and deeply connected to the tropical surroundings.

The staff are warm, discreet, and genuinely attentive, making you feel welcome without ever being intrusive. Their kindness enhances the feeling that you are not just staying somewhere — you are being gently cared for.

**The Sergeant Hotel is not simply accommodation; it is a memorable experience, a quiet luxury cocoon immersed in tropical beauty.**

**Rating: 10/10**  
*Perfect for travelers seeking authenticity, elegance, and peace.
title: "Sergeant Hotel: Tropical elegance, peaceful luxury, and authentic Sri Lankan charm in Unawatuna."

roomTip:
Do have a full body massage
Do take dinner at the hotel
Avoid the Cave Room unless you are fit and nimble
text:
Sergeant House is fully deserving of its top rating.

We stayed for six nights in February 2025.

The management and staff are so professional and do their utmost to ensure a happy stay. The rooms with one caveat (see below) are superb, as is the swimming pool and the grounds. It is a peaceful oasis just off the busy road that tracks the coast.

It is a small hotel which is something we like - the pool never gets crowded and the service is personal. 

Dinner in the hotel is excellent. It has to be ordered before 11am and the chef will prepare dishes not on the menu (we had delicious grilled fish on our last night). We also ate out at the nearby Kabala Sunset and Sun n Sea plus the Dumpling House in Galle. All were good.

The lady providing massages onsite was brilliant and reasonably priced. I did the hotel's suggested bike tour around the local lagoon and coconut husk/rope making 'factory' which was hugely enjoyable and easy (despite the gear-less bike) thanks to the brilliant guide.

Caveat: Think carefully before booking the Cave Room. It is small and the second single bed is up some steep stairs. We are in our seventies and it was not really suitable for us.  Fortunately there were some empty rooms for some of the nights and the hotel manager made everything perfect so a very big thank you to her.
title: First Class: Impeccable

roomTip: Take mosquito spray
text:
This small and beautiful boutique hotel offers a super tranquil and luxury escape away from the hustle and bustle of Unawatuna on Sri Lanka’s south coast. The colonial design of the hotel with just seven rooms to choose from, combines local charm with incredible personal service. Add to that its private beach just across the road from the hotel and you have a stunning hotel we would love to return to. We even saw turtles from the beach.

Sergeant House in Unawatuna has a really laid-back yet stylish vibe. The staff are incredibly welcoming, and there’s a super homely feeling to the place, When you enter the property from a busy road you can’t believe how quiet the space is and how you feel in the middle of nature.

The swimming pool is perfectly formed for the number of guests and the sunbeds that sit within the pool itself are a lovely touch. There are small jacuzzi style pools around the grounds too. Massages can be booked and both myself and my eldest had massages which were excellent.
title: Incredible personal service at this small boutique hotel

ownerResponse/text:

Manager
placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
Our family group of six adults had the pleasure of staying in The Sergeant’s Bungalow at Sergeant House for three nights including Christmas 2024. 
It is a relaxing haven with lovely gardens and central swimming pool. You do not hear any noise from the busy road at the front. There is access to their own private section of the beach across the road.
The manager, Chathuri, was so helpful from the moment we made our booking. We wanted to travel by train from Colombo to Galle - she suggested which train to book and arranged for a van to meet us at Galle Station. She also organised our onward transport by van to our next destination - Yala. Tuk tuks were arranged for when we took a day trip to Galle. We were also able to enjoy a personal cooking class with the Sergeant House chef.
The food is a highlight. We were especially lucky to be treated to amazing Christmas Day breakfast and dinner (and gifts!)
The staff are outstanding. A small dedicated team who are professional, helpful and friendly.
Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so memorable. We would love to return

Tips: Book directly for the best deal
          Stay longer than one night
title: A very special boutique hotel

placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
There’s so much to swoon over at this curious boutique villa that’s perfectly situated from right across the beach at Unawatuna. The staggering façade comes courtesy of its historic colonial architecture that traces all the way back to the 1800s; and its interiors characterized by a disarming confluence of rattan accents, antique decor, and traditional furniture that sets the tone of a perfect coastal vibe.

Lest you think it’s all face and no substance, you’ll be chuffed to learn that the folks at Sergeants’ House also offers exemplary service by any standards, and were very warm, accommodating and easy going. There was also something comfortingly communal about the fact that the room doors don’t lock (the family staying right across me literally left the doors wide open the entire day); and there was not a second throughout my stay that I got worried or paranoid that my things would get stolen, by staff or the other occupants. And that says ALOT because I am generally a very distrusting person  – especially when I am travelling. Something about the place works on a very unspoken level of intrinsic trust, and you get cloaked with the same kind understanding the instant you walk through its tall heavy gates, like magic.
title: This Stay Perfected Unawatuna For Me

text:
Wow what a place! Once you enter the beautiful gardens, you feel relaxed, calm and peaceful. 
The old buildings are beautifully and sympathetically decorated with so much attention to detail. 
The swimming pool has some sun and shaded areas and beautifully clean.
My husband had a massage, which he enjoyed.
Our room was the suite. Now I have to say, I travel around 9 months of the year and this is one of the best and biggest I have stayed in. We compared it as just short of Raffles in Singapore. Every little detail was thought about. Plenty of room for your toiletries, a plug next to a mirror for the hairdryer, socket next to the bed, etc.
The evening dinner was very romantic, a beautiful setting in an open dining area by the pool. The food was delicious too.
We were lucky enough to have the whole place to ourselves as it was low season. It felt like it was your own beautiful home.
Sadly we only had time for one night. When we next visit Sri Lanka we will be checking in for a week.
title: Outstanding

placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
I booked a bungalow at Sergeant House for a 2-day stay in July for me and my family during our visit to Sri Lanka. This experience was very different from staying at regular star hotels. Sergeant House is an old mansion that has been renovated to include modern facilities while preserving its original look and feel.

The rooms were very spacious. The one I booked had three bedrooms, and the master bedroom featured an outdoor bathroom. The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, ensuring that our stay was comfortable and enjoyable.

One of the highlights of our stay was the food—it's amazing, and hats off to the chef! I ordered lunch off the menu because I wanted to try authentic Sri Lankan food, and the chef arranged it for us. The taste was so satisfying that I ordered it again for the next day’s lunch.

If you want to have a massage, you don’t need to go out as it's available on the property in a very relaxing environment. I did enjoy it and highly recommend giving it a try.

Additionally, Sergeant House has a private beach, which, although not beachfront, is easily accessible by crossing the road. We spent a good three hours there, although we didn't swim as the sea was rough. The 24-hour pool was another great feature—we had a night swim, and it was a fantastic experience.

Overall, Sergeant House is beautiful and provides a unique and wonderful stay. I will surely be back when I return to Sri Lanka. Thank you for taking care of us during our stay!
title: Cozy Stay at Unawatuna

ownerResponse/text:

Our whole stay was 5 star

roomTip: If you are looking for a comfortable hotel without the more intimate offerings of an owner run plantation house, then W15 is for you.
text:
Perhaps we’re unfair but we’d come from an owner-managed tea plantation house where we’d been treated as friends and encouraged to meet other guests with a welcome drinks session and we expected the same at W15. However, it all seemed rather impersonal.. any requests to staff, including ordering dinner, are done by WhatsApp. The room was comfortable and spacious with an excellent bathroom and a much needed heater! 
Dinner was fortunately on the terrace (room for two tables) as the dining room was rather cold and unwelcoming.
title: Comfortable but lacks character

Dear Quest52605258989, 

Thank you for your heartfelt review! We’re absolutely delighted to hear that you had such a wonderful stay with us. From the welcome to the peaceful surroundings, it’s great to know that every detail contributed to a memorable experience.

placeInfo/address: No. 55 Upper Lake Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: From the moment we arrived we were well looked after with warm towels and a welcome tea which was delicious. We then had a smooth check in and were able to order a late lunch, the food was excellent the best we have had in Sri Lanka, we were able to eat our lunch with a view over the lake and the gardens it is beautiful and peaceful, which was well needed after a busy travel through Sri Lanka so far. The rooms are well thought out and have everything we could need, there were sustainable products and everything was plastic free. There was a lovely tea and coffee station in the room which was adorable and also sustainable with glass jars for the tea. It was also delicious. We later had a lovely dinner in the dining room which was beautiful with a chandelier and a fire on which was so beautiful. The food was delicious and the service from Lakisanka was attentive, gentle and kind. The beds were very comfortable and a great size. In the morning we had a lovely breakfast on the deck overlooking the lake again it was so so peaceful and lovely in the sun. We had juice, coffee and tea, fresh fruit platter, fresh bread and pastries with homemade jam (the rhubarb is amazing) and then got our main that we choose, we had French toast (best French toast we have ever had) and the superfood breakfast which was delicious too. Thank you for having us, and thank you for your service Lakisanka and the rest of the team.
title: Amazing stay

roomTip: Book a pool villa
text: The Water Gardens was a superbly calm and restful experience at the start of our Sri Lanka holiday. The whole vibe of the hotel is very zen, with expanses of rectangular lily-covered ponds, skirted by paths providing good walks and runs, with the added bonus of peacocks displaying their feathers along the way! The hotel provided an excellent place from which to visit Lion Rock, Polonnaruwa and Dambulla. Our only regret is that we stayed only 2 nights, as we would have loved to stay longer. We were pleased we booked a pool suite, which gave us a good way to cool off without going to the main swimming pool (which looks fantastic, by the way). The food was excellent and incredibly good value for a 5-star hotel in a location where they could get away with charging much more. Even the drinks were reasonable ($5 for a 600 ml Lion beer and $10 for a large wine or cocktail). The best aspect was the staff and their attention to service throughout the resort. They all looked so happy and made us also feel so.
title: Beautiful surroundings, 5-star service and food right in the Cultural Triangle

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: Highly recommended. An impressive hotel, layed out as a series of bungalows surrounding pools filled with lilies, birds and fish. Peacocks welcome you with their flashing feathers and cries. The architecture is modern with a nod to tradition, and the rooms are large and exceptionally well furnished with comfortable beds, seating and spacious bathrooms. I didn't enjoy the public buildings (bar, restaurant) as much in terms of interior design, they seemed a bit generic. Service was always attentive--restaurant and bar staff remembered our preferences and were always welcoming. Spa was well equipped and excellent massages. The main pool feels a bit stark and exposed, but the bungalow plunge pools are a great alternative. Cuisine was stellar if you choose from the Sri Lankan dishes...the more European menu seemed too large and unfocused and the results were not at the same high level IMO. The highlight of our stay was an alms ceremony arranged by the in-house naturalist at a local village temple. A very beautiful experience that I know is challenging to put together and I really appreciated the extra effort. Great location with easy access to the various sites in Sigiriya.
title: You should go

text:
This was my first stay at Water Garden Sigiriya, and I'm happy to say it definitely won't be my last!  Everything from the moment our group arrived to the moment we left was excellent and I look forward to bringing more friends to experience this hotel soon. 

The staff of the hotel deserve a special shoutout. They were so accommodating and did everything possible to make our stay as comfortable and relaxing as possible and even arranged outside activities for us, including an elephant safari. The staff would go out of their way to make sure any special requests we had were fulfilled, and even gave us their WhatsApp contact info should we need to contact them for anything. The staff also helped my sister and her friend look for some of the crocodiles that populate the water gardens of the hotel, when one was spotted, they would contact her and show up at her villa in one of the hotel buggies ready to rush to the last known croc sighting location. 

The food at the hotel was delicious, the locals and foreign tourists our group comprised of loved everything that the kitchen made for us. The Sri Lankan food deserves particular praise and I'd highly recommend that all guests try their local Sri Lankan food options. The kitchen was also happy to make adjustments to their meals, one of which was having the kitchen make their Kottu using crab instead of the chicken they normally use. The kitchen was happy to oblige, and I have to say it was amazing! I highly recommend any guest put in a special request for a crab kottu, you won't be disappointed.

The hotel has a few types of villas, our group got a duplex villa which could comfortably house 4 people in two separate bedrooms each with their own large bathroom. We also booked two Superior Deluxe villas which can comfortably house 2 to 3 people in one bedroom. Both of the villa types we had contained a private plunge pool, which is a great place to stargaze from on the clear nights. The villas are spacious, clean, and well appointed with modern amenities including universal plug points. The staff would also come by and ask if there was anything we needed, and would also leave homemade local treats like milk toffee or coconut toffee in the room after cleaning, which was a nice touch. 

I'd highly recommend getting a treatment from the spa, the masseuses are well trained and know how to release those tensed-up/knotted muscles. Be sure to book the day before as the spa can get booked up quickly. 

The hotel is on a very large property, so I'd recommend getting a bicycle from the lobby and using that to get around unless you're more fond of walking. There are also plenty of animals that also live in the property, including peacocks, monkeys, tortoises, and monitor lizards, which add to the ambiance of the hotel and create a unique experience when randomly encountering one of the animals when walking around the hotel grounds. 

Our group stayed for two nights, but by the end we wished we could have stayed longer. After my experience, I can see why this hotel is so highly rated, and I'm looking forward to my next visit soon.
title: One of the best hotels in Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Hello SuebT5VD, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback about your recent stay with us. We are firstly delighted that you found our accommodation to exceed your expectations and that the cleanliness, spaciousness, and particularly the spectacular view of the rock from your pool were highlights of your stay. 

Regarding your dining experience, we appreciate your feedback and would like to clarify a few points about our half-board package options. While you opted for the five-course dinner menu, please note that our half-board guests actually have three dining options available:

The set menu of the day with options.
Selection of a main course from our traditional Sri Lankan menu.
Selection of a main courses from the a la carte menu if the former 2 menus are not to your personal liking. 

We understand that views on food and preferences naturally vary from person to person and across different cultures and that dining experiences are highly subjective, yet we respect the opinions of all our guests. 

Additionally, while bottled water does incur a charge in most hotels, we do offer complimentary filtered jug water throughout your meal service. My apologies if this information was not clearly communicated during your stay, and we will make sure to better inform our guests about these options moving forward.

Your observations about the indoor dining area and service style are noted. On the days in question during your stay period, we had 2 large groups resident in the hotel who had requested one long table to be placed on the terrace area of the restaurant. Naturally moving most of tables from the air-conditioned indoor area to the outer terrace would have created an ambiance of emptiness which I can assure is not the norm on other days. We will however see how best we can balance both the indoor and outdoor seating arrangements.  We also appreciate your comparison with other Sri Lankan hotels, presumably done with hotels in the same league as ours, as this helps us benchmark our services. 

Thank you again for your candid feedback. We hope to welcome you back in the future, where we will strive to match the excellence of your accommodation experience across all aspects of your stay.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try and get the villa with a view of the rock. Don’t include dinner in your package
text:
There is nothing wrong with this hotel, but we found the food and service below the very high standards in the other hotels we stayed at in Sri Lanka. The accommodation itself is excellent - very clean, spacious, comfortable and we had an amazing view of the rock from our pool - thank you.
We were on a half-board package and found the food both rather ordinary and a bit pretentious.  The bread was not always fresh and the 5 🤷‍♀️ course dinner menu had limited options. Fresh water was not included with dinner - it was charged extra. The inside seating, when there wasn’t space on the veranda, was soulless.
The service was reasonably efficient, but impersonal in comparison with the other hotels.
In summary we had a fine, but not exceptional, experience.
title: Excellent accommodation, food and service a bit average

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Peter, 

Thank you for sharing your wonderful feedback about your stay with us. We are absolutely thrilled to hear about the exceptional service provided by Dinuka. His dedication to ensuring your comfort and going above and beyond to return your forgotten item truly exemplifies the highest standards of hospitality we strive to maintain. I will definitely convey your kind sentiments to him and appreciate his actions. 

We appreciate your honest feedback about our villas . Regular ongoing maintenance is in progress in all villas and public spaces and we do take pride in their cleanliness and upkeep. We are glad you found them comfortable during your stay.

Regarding dining preferences, we couldn't agree more about our Sri Lankan cuisine - it's indeed one of our specialties. Whilst opinions on food and preferences naturally vary from person to person and across different cultures, we respect the opinions of all our guests.  We understand that dining experiences are highly subjective and we are delighted that you enjoyed our traditional Sri Lankan offerings, which showcase the authentic flavors of our region.

Once again, thank you for your detailed review and for choosing to stay with us. We hope to welcome you back again soon.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Plan to do Sigiriya very early morning or late in the day after the crowds have gone.
text:
A lovely retreat about 25 minutes drive from the rock itself.  A couple of the villas have views towards Sigiriya.  We opted for a superior bungalow with plunge pool which was incredibly spacious. The pool itself was welcome after a hot day out. The villas are starting to look a little tired but are well cleaned and maintained.
Our stay was really made special by our butler, Dinuka. His service was outstanding -- he is a very nice guy, always with a friendly smile and nothing is ever any trouble and he sorts out any needs or problems immediately. He made us feel so welcome. He is a natural for high end hospitality industry. 
After we departed, he discovered we had left an item behind in the villa and he contacted us and went to enormous lengths so we could be reunited with it before leaving Sri Lanka. What more can I say? Thank you Dinuka .
As for the food, best to stick to the Sri Lankan options as it's what they do best.  Many of the European dishes at dinner sounded and looked good but were disappointing to eat. 
Butler and housekeeping service get 5 stars.  Food gets less.
title: Wonderful service.

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Cristina, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay with us. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed our spacious villas, comfortable mattresses, and warm pool facilities. 

My apologies with regard to the housekeeping issues you have mentioned. We have reviewed our housekeeping cleaning logs and they indicate that our housekeeping team did attempt to service your villa but due to the Do Not Disturb mode being active, we respected your privacy preference and did not enter the room. The next day when the team arrived at your villas for the service it was declined one member of your party.  Unfortunately as the soiled linen was laced inside the closet with the rest of your personal belongings,  our protocol requires us to wait for explicit permission to collect them, which unfortunately did not happen during your stay. As some of the bottles of water were half full and not empty they were not removed. While this explains the situation, it does not excuse the suboptimal cleanliness you experienced and I apologise for the mishap. 

Thank you for having booked and stayed with us and I look forward to welcoming you all back.
Enjoy the rest of your time in Sri Lanka. 

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Tim, 

WOW......and thank you so much for taking the time to share your wonderful experiences at our resort! We are absolutely thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us, and I am delighted to hear that our lakeside setting created such memorable moments for you. I am also particularly pleased that you appreciated our spa facilities and yoga sessions - we have created spaces where our guests can truly unwind and rejuvenate. Kawshika your Butler will be thrilled to be singled out by name and I will make sure to pass along your praise.

We completely understand about the dining costs, though we are glad you found the quality and atmosphere worthwhile. That said, we appreciate your feedback and will definitely take it into consideration for future improvements. Most importantly, we are delighted that you chose to spend a relaxation day with us rather than touring. Sometimes the best memories are made right here by our lakes, watching nature unfold while enjoying some well-deserved tranquility.

Thank you again for choosing to stay with us. Please do come back again someday. Until then, warm regards from our little corner of paradise.......

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is immaculately presented with rooms set around their series of lakes. The rooms are spacious and well equipped with everything you would expect from a 5* hotel. The wildlife around the lakes is a real feature and you will see, Kingfisher, Eagles, Egrets, Monitor Lizards as well as the hotels three crocodiles! The Spa is excellent and the free yoga sessions very well operated. You have your own butler to organise your day and Nishantha was friendly and efficient. Food and drink service was very good and whilst the food prices and obviously significantly higher than elsewhere the quality was good and the environment beautiful. We took a day off from touring at the hotel which was a great decision allowing us to relax and unwind.
title: Sri Lanka Tour 2025

ownerResponse/text:
Hello PMand LW, 

Thank you so much for sharing such wonderful details about your stay with us! We are absolutely thrilled that our little slice of paradise exceeded your expectations. 

Kawshika is thrilled that he was able to make such a positive impact on your stay. All our butlers pride themselves on being always available and attentive, and Diman certainly seems to have embodied that spirit perfectly. He is thrilled to read our kind sentiments. 
We have carefully crafted our menu to showcase both authentic Sri Lankan cuisine and international favorites, and it's wonderful to hear that we hit the mark. 

We couldn't agree more about starting the day with yoga here. There's something truly magical about practicing amidst nature and your description of practicing yoga with Rikki while watching monkeys and peacocks roam around the yoga pavilion perfectly captures the serene atmosphere we aim to create here at Water Garden Sigiriya. 

While the hotel is best enjoyed over a 2 night stay or longer, we would love to welcome you back for that longer winter break you mentioned. There is always more to explore here, and we promise Rikki will keep the monkeys entertained while you perfect your practice.

Thank you again for choosing Water Garden Sigiriya. Your kind words inspire us to continue creating these special moments for all our guests.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't rush your stay here - build in some time to enjoy the hotel. Try the yoga!
text:
The lodges are set among gardens and lakes with views over to Sigiriya. The quality of the rooms (lounge, bedroom and deck) was stunning. Our butler, Diman Kawshika swapped WhatsApp numbers and was always on hand to organise things for us. He was professional, attentive and always had a smile on his face. 

The quality of the restaurant was perfect. Plenty of Sri Lanka and international dishes with space to eat inside or outside. 

We only stayed 2 nights here on a tour but could easily imagine escaping here for a longer winter break. The hotel can organise plenty of activities locally, there's space to walk/cycle and a great gym/spa. 

I highly recommend starting the day with a yoga session with Rikki in the yoga pavilion, which looks out on water and has monkeys and peacocks milling around. Rikki’s a brilliant teacher and the yoga was different to yoga I’ve done at home. There’s more emphasis on breathing (something I’m a bit lazy about) and I felt like I was using my core differently. 

When you’ve got a busy itinerary there’s a lot of pressure to eat breakfast and be in the car by 9am, but starting the day with yoga/meditation was one of the highlights of my trip to Sri Lanka.   

I was so spaced out after one session I forgot how to unlock my phone (which is no small feat, since my face unlocks it)! Another day a monkey came to watch. I’d go back to Water Garden just for the yoga.

Wonderful hotel fully deserving of its high feedback
title: Stunning

ownerResponse/text:
Hello travel5612, 

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are absolutely thrilled that your found our hotel to be a Birder's Delight. The many ponds, lakes and water ways are home to thriving marine eco systems. I am delighted that our nature-focussed in room amenities - from the bird-watching books to the complimentary binoculars, warmed your hearts as it is exactly what we hoped to create for fellow nature lovers!

Our butlers play a crucial role in the guest experience and they all take immense pride in their role. I will definitely convey your very kind sentiments to them. The terrace of the main bar upstairs is a favorite spot for many of our guests, offering that perfect blend of refreshing cocktails and stunning views over our grounds and the Sigiriya Rock. 

Thank you again for choosing Water Garden Sigiriya and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya.
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Wow- loved this hotel. A birders’ paradise. We stayed in a one bedroom villa with a lovely deck overlooking the lake. Room was clean and comfy. High quality linens etc. We appreciated the binoculars, the books on birds, trees and flowers. Also provided a Ceylon recipe book. Our butler was fantastic and was helpful and personable. 
Because we were only there for two rights we didn’t get a chance to use their spa or gym or pools. They all looked inviting. 
Food was delicious and the variety was amazing. Wait staff were friendly and efficient. We loved the upstairs bar area overlooking the grounds and pool. Great cocktails and snacks. Bartender was welcoming. 
Highly recommended- one of our favorite hotels in Sei Lanka.
title: Birder’s Delight

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Phoebe,
 
It was indeed a pleasure meeting you. WOW...................what can I say, we are all absolutely touched by your wonderful review! Reading about how you planned your next visit before even leaving us brought huge smiles to all our faces here. Your apt description of our tranquil water gardens and playful peacocks perfectly captures the peaceful atmosphere we strive to create.

I particularly loved hearing about the warm welcome you received but what truly makes me proud is hearing about the exceptional service from our team members. Dilanka and his romantic poolside dinner setup under the rising moon sounds absolutely perfect for a honeymoon celebration not to mention Shashika and his attention to detail with your preferences. I will definitely convey your kind sentiments to them both. 

We look forward to welcoming you both back, perhaps for your first wedding anniversary. Thank you again for sharing your beautiful honeymoon memories with us. Your happiness is what makes everything we do worthwhile.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Try it all. Rooms are great but take the time to explore the property and nearby activities!
text:
We stayed here for our honeymoon and couldn’t help but plan our next return before we’d even left. From your first steps onto the property you are met by lush, tranquil water gardens and beautiful wildlife (although don’t let that get to the peacocks heads!)
You are greeted with delicious juice, a cold towel, and friendly faces right away. 
Then you step further into the property and see clay paths as far as the eye could see. 
The staff is exceptional - Dilanka, our butler, and Saseesh, our restaurant server, went above and beyond to make our stay special. Dilanka planned a dinner by the pool to watch the moon rise and Sasheesh remembered our water and food preferences from night one - not to mention had the friendliest smile we’d ever seen. 
David does everything he can to make you feel valued as a guest, stopping each night to chat with us even though they are in peak busy season.
title: Friendly faces, unforgettable setting

ownerResponse/text:
Hello jhhamil,

Thank you for taking the time to share such a wonderful review of your recent stay with us. I am delighted to hear that you had a memorable experience at our property during your Sri Lanka tour.

It was a pleasure meeting you on arrival and I am particularly pleased to know that Dinuka and Salindu provided you with exceptional service. Our team takes great pride in creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere for our guests, and I will personally commend them for their outstanding contributions to your stay.

Your kind words about our location overlooking Sigiriya rock, the peaceful grounds, spacious accommodations, and the quality of our dining offerings are much appreciated. I will also convey your kind sentiments to our Executive Chef and his team. Yes the natural symphony of peacocks is indeed one of the unique features that makes Water Garden Sigiriya special. There are many eco systems within our property which attract many species of birds and mammals. Tharindu, our Naturalist cum Game Ranger is always around to provide a guided tour of the gardens. 

We are honoured that you would recommend our hotel to others and are thrilled to hear of your intention to return.  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Sri Lanka.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited this hotel as part of our 9 day Sri Lanka tour.  We received a warm welcome from everyone;  the Manager, Yoga teacher and reception staff.  There is a wonderful view of Sigiriya rock from the reception area.  We were given a tour of the grounds and villa by our lovely Butler Dinuka who was superb throughout our stay.  The accommodation was specious, well designed and very clean.  Our breakfasts and dinners throughout were excellent and always served with a smile by our lovely waiter Salindu.  The grounds are spacious and extremely peaceful, in fact the only noise you hear are from the peacocks.  

We would definitely have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and intend to return.  Thank you to everyone who helped to make our stay so memorable.
title: Wonderful!

text:
We went here to get away for a couple of days, and it was a great choice for that. We did arrive during the offseason where there are less guests. 
They welcomed us with a traditional drummer and another traditional ceremony, lighting of the lamp. 
The hotel is situated by the lagoon in Bentota, on the beach. The hotel is is very classy and site on the property well, and the landscaping to match. I was told that the design was done by J. Bawa, and it is simple and beautiful. 
The rooms are very clean, good size, well maintained and most of them provide a view of the ocean. There is also a balcony for each room and the views are very calming. 
There are 2 pools and they are well kept by the pool staff. 
All the staff here are very helpful and I would rate them as excellent. 
The food was very good but, there is a lot of room for improvement. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had very good choices, including freshly made hoppers and roti. The dinner buffet could use some improvement as it could use more Sri Lankan dishes. The grill area was pretty good and it is a great idea. 

Overall, we loved the stay here and would definitely stay here again.
title: Beautiful photos

Dear Valued Guest, 
Greetings from Araliya Green City - Nuwara Eliya!
Thank you so much for your amazing review! We are truly delighted to hear that your stay at Hotel Araliya Green City was such a memorable experience. It means a lot to us that you enjoyed our spacious property, warm hospitality, and especially the Indian cuisine prepared by Chef Mohammad.
Your kind words for our team members — Mr. Ananda, Mr. Vignesh, Mr. Chamodi, Mrs. Shehan, Mr. Migara, Ms. Vijitha, and Chef Mohammad — are deeply appreciated and will certainly be shared with them.

The Management Team
Araliya Green City – Nuwara Eliya
placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Our stay at Hotel Araliya Green City was truly memorable! The property is stunning spacious, well-designed, and located right in the heart of Nuwara Eliya, offering a perfect blend of luxury and comfort. Everything from the lobby to the rooms to the in-house facilities reflects elegance and high standards.

The service was excellent. The team was warm, responsive, and very accommodating. We were especially grateful that they upgraded our room upon request, which made our stay even more enjoyable. The upgraded room was spacious, comfortable, and offered beautiful views it made us feel pampered and valued as guests.

One of the biggest highlights was the Indian food we got at the restaurant it was absolutely delicious! The quality, taste, and presentation were on point, and it truly felt like a slice of home away from home.

Special thanks to the wonderful staff who made our experience so smooth and welcoming
Mr. Ananda, Mr. Vignesh, Mr. Chamodi, Mrs. Shehan, Mr. Migara, Ms. Vijitha, and especially Chef Mohammad, who was incredibly kind and talented. Each of them brought a personal touch to their service l smiling, attentive, and ready to help. Chef Mohammad made sure our meals were perfect and catered to our preferences with care and warmth. Their generosity and kindness made us feel truly looked after.

From the rooms to the dining to the hospitality everything exceeded our expectations. Would highly recommend Hotel Araliya Green City to anyone visiting Nuwara Eliya. It’s not just a hotel, it’s an experience and we would absolutely love to come back!
title: Amazingg

text:
My friend and I had a beautiful overnight stay in Lake Lodge. 
The pool was so inviting and relaxing. We enjoyed a couple of ice cold beers before our Ayurveda massage (wich was incredible)
We had a beautiful dinner prepared by the chef, western and Sri Lankan food is available from the menu. You have to try the spicy chicken curry. So good!
The rooms are lovely with a view of treetops. Also have all the amenities and mini bar. 
We were looked after so well by the beautiful, friendly staff. On arrival we lit the tall brass welcoming candle. Such a lovely touch with tradition. 
I thoroughly recommend to Stay at Lake Lodge. You will want to stay longer. We wish we could’ve. 
🙏
title: Boutique Hotel

roomTip: Ein Ort zum Wohlfühlen mit absolut top Essen und einem sehr guten Service.
text: Wir waren traurig als wir die Lake Lodge nach zwei Tagen wieder verlassen mussten. Vom ersten Moment an hatten wir uns in der Lake Lodge sehr wohl gefühlt. Das sehr aufmerksame, nette  Personal und vor allem der Besitzer Michel, der das Herz am rechten Fleck hat. Verwöhnt wurden wir abends vor dem Essen mit einem Apero. Das Essen war das Beste, was wir während unserer gesamten Reise durch Sri Lanka hatten. Dass vielleicht hier und da in der Lodge der Lack etwas ab war, machte das damit durchaus wett. Jeden Abend ein Betthupferl. Auch die Lage, das Frühstück am Pool inmitten von Bäumen.  Und den Affen zuschauen  wie sie sich von Baum zu Baum schwingen. Alles in allem ein Ort zum weiterempfehlen und wir kommen wieder.
title: Lake Lodge die Wohlfühllodge

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share such a beautifully detailed and thoughtful review of your stay with us.

It was a true pleasure to welcome you to Lake Lodge, and we’re absolutely delighted to hear that your experience here stood out as the most enjoyable of your 18 days in Sri Lanka. Your kind words about our service, rooms, and especially our restaurant mean a great deal to the entire team.

We take immense pride in anticipating our guests' needs and creating a truly relaxing and memorable atmosphere, so it’s wonderful to know that these efforts made a difference in your stay—from the warm welcome by Michel and myself, to the little touches poolside and at dinner.

Your high praise of our cuisine, especially in comparison to such esteemed establishments across the island, is humbling and deeply appreciated. Our culinary team will be thrilled to hear your feedback.

Thank you once again for your generous recommendation. We sincerely hope to welcome you back to Lake Lodge in the future for another unforgettable stay.

Warmest regards,
Pulasthi Nanayakkara
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting Sigiriya (Lion Rock), Poloonaruwa and Dambulla (Temple Caves)

This 12 room luxury resort is located near the shores of Lake Kandalama, near Dambulla and is well located to visit other attractions in the region including those I mentioned above.

We were personally greeted by the owner Michel and his Manager on arrival and check-in procedures were conducted pool side overlooking the lake whilst sipping our welcome drink.

The rooms are large, spotlessly clean and well equipped with everything you could possibly want or need.

This hotel is all about service. Everything is anticipated by the staff. Drinks and snacks appear as soon as you settle by the pool, rooms are tidied and clean the minute you step out the door, the waiter appears to take your order as soon as you look up and a staff member appears like magic with a torch to light your way back to your room after your meal.

Please, please do eat at the restaurant as it is like having your own personal chef. We ate at some great restaurants in The Galle Face in Colombo, The Grand Hotel in Nuwara Eliya and the Marriot Hotel at Weligama Beach but for us the three meals we had at the Lake Lodge were the best we had in our 18 days in Sri Lanka. We would also rate our stay here as the most enjoyable.
title: Secluded Luxury - 5 Star Service

Your compliments about our staff’s attentiveness and warmth truly mean a lot. Michel and the entire team are committed to making every guest feel welcome and cared for, and it’s wonderful to see that reflected in your experience.

text:
Cet hôtel est un petit bijou... Tout est pensé dans les moindres détails! Les chambres sont spacieuses, d’une propreté irréprochable. Le cadre est magnifique, parfait pour une parenthèse de calme et de détente après une journée de visites dans le triangle culturel.

Le service est exceptionnel, aussi bien à l'hôtel qu’au restaurant. Le personnel est attentionné, professionnel et toujours souriant. Michel, le patron, est très acceuillant et a inculqué a ses employés vrai souci de la qualité et du confort des clients!

Le restaurant mérite a lui seul une mention spéciale... Des plats savoureux, un service irréprochable et une ambiance chaleureuse. Bref, une expérience parfaite du début à la fin. On ne peut que fortement le recommander!
title: Coup de coeur

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here for three nights, and really enjoyed the experience. We were greeted by the owner, who made us feel welcome from the start. 

A lovely comfortable room, with a nice outlook and good facilities. What really set this place apart was the quality of the food, both in taste and presentation. They have an excellent chef, who came out afterwards to chat with guests, as did the owner. 

All the other staff were excellent too; friendly, efficient and professional. Holding the restaurant open a bit later than usual to accommodate our late arrival from watching the Slender Loris was really welcome! 

Small touches like the glasses of juice and some fruit brought to the room each evening before dinner, and the chocolates on the bed, really added to the overall experience. 

We didn't use the pool as we're not swimmers, but it looked really good

Thoroughly recommended!
title: An excellent base for the Dambulla area, with superb food.

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Enjoy the food, it is such good quality.
text:
To us Lake Lodge seemed a bit dated and tired, which could easily be modernised, especially the concrete tat littering the beautiful grounds.
The biggest delight for us though was the food... EXQUISITE ...
The service at mealtimes was excellent and the quality and variety served was the best we had on our whole 30 day holiday.
We stayed for 6 nights and visited Popham's, Ritigala Monastery ruins, Kaudula Park and even a long drive to Wasgomuva Park, which is so less visited and full of birds.
It is no boutique experience but has a charm all of its own with wonderful staff.
title: Best food ever...
