text:
We arrived on 23 June 2025 and were received by a nice lady and a traditional drummer. We didn’t realise it was for us, but thought there probably was a wedding taking place; nice reception. Indunil and Pasan from the reception found a great room for us on the ground floor with access to the garden.
In the restaurants we were taken very well care of by  Sudesh, Ruwantha, Ranil, Nishadhi, Naveen, Dasun, Malik , Isuru and other staff we unfortunately didn’t get all the names of. Thaala’s staff is great and knows how to make the guests feel welcome and at home. Food was great as usual, specially the local dishes. 
We had a great 3 days and thank all of the staff making our short holiday a success. We hope to return soon

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Although we had a tub in our bathroom, water pressure isn’t sufficient to fill warm tub.
text:
This charming and intimate boutique hotel was a great anchor accommodation for 4 days of touring Sigiriya, Dambulla, Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa.  The pool was fabulous, staff became familiar with us and consistently exceeded expectations.  

Room was clean and spacious.  Air conditioning worked great and was appreciated since it rained most everyday, a nice reprieve from the hot sticky outdoors…

We enjoyed our breakfasts of delicious Sri Lankan omelettes, fresh fruits and breads.  (Ask for Sri Lankan heat in omelettes if you like spicy, which we do!)

We ate dinner at the hotel 3 nights—all were very good.  They offer a varied menu with nightly specials.

Owner, Michelle, and all the staff made our stay very nice.
title: Charming boutique hotel with great customer service!

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text: In diesem kleinen, individuell geführten Privathotel fühlt man sich gut aufgehoben und umsorgt. Nach einer Safari oder Erkundung der alten Königsstätten kann der Gast im großen Pool wunderbar relaxen oder auf seinem Balkon einen spektakulären Sonnenuntergang genießen. Vor dem Abendessen werden als Geste des Hauses Drinks gereicht. Dieses Hotel ist das Werk und Refugium des Eigentümers Michel, der die Gäste in mehreren Sprachen betreut. Er ist das Herz des Hauses und ein guter Gastgeber, der Wert auf liebevolle Details legt. Anil verwöhnt die Gäste als Küchenchef mit wunderbaren Gerichten und einem guten Frühstück. Trotz Männerwirtschaft ist das Hotel sehr sauber und aufgeräumt.
title: Schönes Privathotel mit gutem Service und bester Küche

roomTip: prévoyez assez de temps pour profiter de l'hôtel, de la piscine et du SPA
text:
Tout est pensé pour satisfaire le client, jusqu'aux petits détails et petites attentions qui font la différence. Les chambres sont très belles, avec un large balcon pour observer le coucher de soleil. L'accueil est formidable, verre de bienvenue et petite serviette glacée pour se rafraîchir après un long voyage. Pendant la journée, on vous offre un petit cocktail et quelques amuses bouches faits maison. Quand aux repas, les restaurants de cette qualité au Sri Lanka se comptent sur les doigts de la main! la présentation des plats, les cuissons qui sont juste parfaites, la qualité des ingrédients, tout était parfait 
Il y a aussi un SPA, le masseur est exceptionnel 
Pour résumer, vous pouvez y aller les yeux fermés, 
seul regret: n'être resté que 2 nuits
title: Expérience exceptionnelle au cœur du Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir waren sofort von der angenehmen Stimmung im Lake Lodge eingenommen. Mitten im Grünen mit zahlreichen alten Bäumen gelegen ist es der ideale Rückzugsort nach einem anstrengenden Tag bei einer der Welterbestätten in der näheren Umgebung (Dambulla Höhlentempel, Sigiriya, Pollonaruwa). Die geräumigen und stilvollen Zimmer sind funktional und praktisch eingerichtet, es fehlt an nichts. Natürlich ist alles blitzblank sauber.
Die Mitarbeitenden waren sehr freundlich, kompetent und diskret und allzeit dafür besorgt, dass wir uns wohl fühlten.
Lake Lodge hat ein ausbiebiges Wellness Angebot, eine schöne offene Lobby, um sich mit anderen Gästen zu unterhalten, die dezente Musik zu geniessen, zu lesen, oder einen Aperitif zu geniessen. 
Es stehen Fahrräder zur Verfügung für Exkursionen in die umliegenden Dörfer, und das Schwimmbad ist wirklich gross - einfach toll, um einige Dutzend Längen zu schwimmen, z. B.  frühmorgens oder vor dem Abendessen. Ja, das Abendessen war ein weiterer Höhepunkt im Lake Lodge – der Chef ist ein Spitzenkoch, er bereitet lokale und internationale Gerichte nach allen Regeln der Kunst zu, einfach Klasse!
title: Oase der Ruhe und Entspannung

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you so much for your heartfelt and detailed review! We’re overjoyed to hear that your time at Lake Lodge was such a memorable and relaxing experience. It’s wonderful that you appreciated the peaceful setting, the beautifully kept grounds, and the little touches like the quirky ornaments and blooming orchids that bring a smile.

We’re delighted that you enjoyed your top-floor room, the birdlife, and the magical sunsets accompanied by complimentary cocktails—our way of making your stay extra special! It’s fantastic to know the Sri Lankan curry and overall dining experience exceeded your expectations, and your kind words for Michel, Pulasthi, Dilshan, and the entire team truly mean the world to us.

We’re so glad we could arrange memorable excursions for you, like the walking safari to see lorises and the jeep safari at Minneriya—what an incredible way to explore the local wildlife. Your thoughtful note about leaving as friends sums up exactly the kind of experience we hope to offer every guest.

Thank you again for sharing your experience and for recommending us so highly. We can’t wait to welcome you back for another fabulous stay

Thank you,
Pulasthi Nanayakkara
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you come in September / October … you may get the place to yourselves.
text:
We stayed here from the 3rd day of our trip to the 6th - and we were treated to the most relaxing and luxurious time. Fortunately for us - but a shame for the hotel and team - we were the only guests here for the duration of our stay, meaning we had the whole place to ourselves. The Lake Lodge only has 10 rooms anyway, but we had the huge beautiful pool, excellent restaurant, and all the team who work here just for us!  
Not only is the property very well laid out and kept pristine, but the quirky little ornaments throughout the place and amazing orchids just bring a smile when you see a new one. 
Our room was on the top floor and looked over part of the gardens and on to a small rainforest area. Very peaceful, with lots of little birds of all shapes, sizes and colours always darting around. 
We watched sunset the first night around 6pm, just as the flying foxes begin to come out to fly away and feed, when there was a knock on the door and two complimentary cocktails arrived with a small bowl of snacks for us to enjoy the sunset even more. One of the many gestures Lake Lodge do to make your stay as fabulous as they can. 
At dinner the first night we met Michel the owner, who was welcoming and friendly.  We had a choice of two starters and three main courses and selected the Sri Lankan Curry as our main course. Amazing … and HUGE portions. Along with your selected curry there are three other vegetable curries and rice. The flours were excellent as was the presentation and service. It was like that all the time we were here. 
In summary, from checking in through to checking out, this has been one of the best experiences of a hotel we have had on our travels over many years. The pool is amazing .. you don’t get Italian Porcelain Patio slabs .. but you are in Sri Lanka!  You get lovely authentic local materials which are kept to the highest degree. 
Pulasthi and his team (a special mention to Dilshan) make you feel so special.  Nothing is too much and you leave the place feeling you’ve left friends behind. Pulasthi also arranged a local walking safari to see Loris’s and a jeep Safari to see the elephants at Minneriya for us - all at prices far less than we had seen online. 
This truly is a REAL boutique hotel experience that you simply must try if you came to the Dambulla/Kandalama area. 
Thank you all at the Lake Lodge.
title: Lake Lodge Luxury

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Karpatha Sands just gets it right.  The place is on a beautiful beach that stretches endlessly.  Rooms are beautifully furnished and extremely comfortable.  The pool and bar are well designed and the food is exceptional.  We thought we would get bored on our four day stay but it ended up being exactly the right time.  Umberto manages the place with a fastidious eye for detail, Nimal was a superb “butler” checking in on us always without ever being intrusive and the wait staff were a true highlight.  Easy five stars for us.

And if you go, befriend the three legged dog (well three working legs)  and he will guard you at night, appreciate every pet and accompany you on every walk.  You will have a loyal companion for the stay.
title: Amazing Chic Hotel and Worth a Special Trip

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
We have just returned home from 2 fabulous weeks at this beautiful hotel, situated on a very beautiful and secluded beach. 
The staff were all amazing - nothing was too much trouble for Umberto the GM and his wonderful team -Sindhu, Namal, Damikaa to name but a few -they all went the extra mile to ensure we had the most wonderful stay. 
We loved our accommodation on the beach-Palam 5. -Beautiful comfortable bed, outdoor garden shower and indoor bath and views to die for of the ocean. Watching the local fisherman every day bringing in their haul was fantastic.  
The food was excellent - whether served in the restaurant, by the pool, on the beach or on our own terrace. Absolutely top quality. And there’s an extensive wine list. 
We loved every moment - if it’s relaxation in a beautiful location you’re after, look no further. 
We can’t wait to return. 
Thank you Umberto, we couldn’t have wished for more!
title: Two weeks in paradise!

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Es ist ein traumhaftes Idyll mit einem paradiesischen Meer. 
Wir haben dort mit der Familie 2 wunderschöne Tage verbracht. 
Die Bungalows sind großräumig und die Terrasse sehr großzügig und wunderschön eingewachsen und gepflegt. 
Das Personal sind alle sehr freundlich. 
Besonders der Manager Roberto ist immer präsent und gibt einem das Gefühl willkommen zu sein. 
Der Pool ist traumhaft angelegt und es gibt am Pool sowie am Meer genügend Liegen. 
Die Snacks die sie am Nachmittags verteilen ist eine angenehme Sache. 
Das Frühstück ist vielseitig und es findet jeder was er gerne mag. 
Am Abend haben wir die Fischplatte für 2 Personen gehabt, sie war reichlich und sehr zu empfehlen. 
Die ganze Anlage ist sehr stylisch und rundum gepflegt. 
In meinen Augen war es ein Highlight auf unserer Reise.
title: Traumhaftes Hotel

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wenn es ein Hotel gibt, das in der Welt der Luxushotels wirklich heraussticht, dann ist es zweifelsohne dieses traumhafte Resort direkt am privaten Strand. Schon bei der Ankunft fühlt man sich wie in einer anderen Welt. Der Empfang durch den persönlichen Butler ist nicht nur eine nette Geste, sondern setzt den perfekten Ton für den gesamten Aufenthalt. Man wird hier nicht einfach nur empfangen, man wird verwöhnt!

Die Wohnzelte – ja, richtig gehört – sind alles andere als gewöhnlich. Sie strahlen Eleganz und Stil aus und sind mit einem Auge fürs Detail eingerichtet. Jedes Element scheint dafür gedacht zu sein, eine Atmosphäre von Luxus und Komfort zu schaffen. Es ist ein Gefühl, als würdest du in ein absolut hochwertiges Boutique-Hotel einchecken, nur eben mitten in der Natur. Wer hätte gedacht, dass Camping auf so hohem Niveau möglich ist? Hier wird Clamping tatsächlich zum Erlebnis.

Die gesamte Anlage ist strahlend schön. Der Pool ist so stilvoll gestaltet, dass man fast vergisst, dass man sich im Freien befindet. Mit bequemen Liegen und schattenspendenden Palmen kannst du dich einfach zurücklehnen und die Seele baumeln lassen. Die Lounge-Bereiche sind ästhetisch und durchdacht eingerichtet – perfekt für entspanntes Zusammensitzen mit Freunden oder für romantische Abende zu zweit. Und wenn du Lust auf einen Sundowner hast, gibt es nichts Besseres, als den Sonnenuntergang über dem Meer zu genießen.

Der private Strandbereich ist ein weiteres Highlight. Hier kommt man in den Genuss eines großen, weißen Sandstrandes, der perfekt zum Entspannen einlädt. Der Zugang zum Meer ist einfach traumhaft. Das glasklare Wasser lädt dazu ein, einen Sprung hinein zu wagen. Vergiss die überfüllten Strände anderer Resorts – hier hast du das Gefühl, dass dieser Strand nur für dich reserviert ist. Es ist der ideale Ort, um die Ruhe der Natur zu genießen oder einfach nur die Füße im Sand zu vergraben.

Was das kulinarische Angebot betrifft, wird man hier mehr als nur verwöhnt. Ob Frühstück oder Abendessen – die Küche des Hauses lässt keine Wünsche offen. Das Essen ist auf einem absoluten Top-Niveau, das selbst die anspruchsvollsten Gaumen begeistert. Die Auswahl an Gerichten ist einfach überwältigend, und jedes Gericht ist nicht nur eine Gaumenfreude, sondern auch ein Fest für die Augen. Man merkt sofort, dass hier aus hochwertigen Zutaten mit viel Liebe zum Detail gekocht wird.

Das Personal ist ein weiterer Grund, warum dieses Hotel so besonders ist. Hier trifft Professionalität auf eine lockere, freundliche Art, die sofort einlädt, sich wohlzufühlen. Jeder Mitarbeiter scheint perfekt auf die Location eingestimmt zu sein. Man merkt, dass sie ihre Arbeit mit Leidenschaft machen und stets bemüht sind, den Gästen jeden Wunsch von den Lippen abzulesen. Diese Kombination aus Effizienz und Herzlichkeit gibt dir das Gefühl, wirklich geschätzt und gut aufgehoben zu sein.

Es ist schwer, die vielen positiven Aspekte dieses Hotels in Worte zu fassen. Es sind eben die Kleinikeiten! Aber eines ist klar: Dieses Resort ist für all jene gemacht, die das Schöne und Feine lieben und in ihrem Leben Wert auf Qualität und das schöne und feine legen. Hier werden die Erwartungen nicht nur erfüllt, sondern weit übertroffen. 

In einer Zeit, in der viele Hotels versuchen, durch Massenbetrieb zu glänzen, ist dieses Resort ein Lichtblick. Es ist ein Ort, an dem du dich wirklich erholen kannst, wo du die Natur in vollen Zügen genießen kannst und wo jeder Moment zählt. Wirklich außergewöhnlich! Wenn du also auf der Suche nach einem unvergesslichen Erlebnis bist, ist dies der perfekte Ort. Ich kann es kaum erwarten, wiederzukommen und mich erneut von diesem wunderbaren Hotel und seinen fantastischen Mitarbeitern verwöhnen zu lassen.
 

Fazit: Das Karpaha und seine Mitarbeiter, ist sicherlich auch auf diesem sehr hohen Niveau, weil Umberto mit seiner unerschöpflichen Erfahrung am Steuer sitzt! Wenn du das nächste Mal auf der Suche nach einer Unterkunft bist, die all deine Erwartungen übertrifft, dann ist dieses Hotel genau das richtige. Hier fühlst du dich nicht nur wie ein Gast, sondern wie ein Teil von etwas Großartigem. Also pack deine Koffer und mach dich bereit für ein Erlebnis, das du niemals vergessen wirst!
title: Ein Juwel für das schöne und gute auf Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Curry of the day was great.  Visit the spa.  Eat the food.
text:
We are sitting by the pool on our last full day here and wanted to take a few mins out of our day to write a review of this lovely hotel.  

This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in.  It’s not just one thing but the entire experience that has just ticked every box.  

I have to talk about Nifras first - our butler.   He worked tirelessly to make our trip perfect.  Having a WhatsApp link is a great idea and he responded to what ever we needed. He was on site from early til late and responded quickly when we needed anything.   He brought us coffee in morning, arranged our trips, answers questions and even sorted my spa bookings for me.   It’s a great idea.  More hotels should give you one contact point.   All the staff are great but Nifras made our holiday.  

The manager Umberto is very present.  He greets all guests at reception and is very friendly and open to discuss anything.  I get the impression he has transformed this hotel from good to great.  He is open to discuss anything that you think may improve the hotel.   He’s a character too and great to speak to.  

Rooms.  When they say it’s a tent - you don’t get a true idea of how
Lovely this is.  We stayed in a Palam suite on the beach.  It was great.  Amazing views when we opened the curtains every morning.  We had our own private loungers on the beach.  Outside showers are lush.  Aircon is loud but very affective.   We would message Nifras when we went to breakfast and he would sort our housekeeping visit for us.  Housekeeping were very efficient and effective and I loved the daily delivery of cookies or cakes.  

Spa was exceptional.  I booked for the Head over heels - 5 treatments over 5 days.  Loved my treatments and really made me feel relaxed and calm.  Therapists were very skilled.  

Food is another high point.   Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all very tasty.  We had a beach bbq one night too.  Lovely.  Our only complaint is that the portions are huge so we did feel
Over faced at times.  But we did learn to share dishes to avoid this.   The prawn cakes are great and I loved the chicken and cashew fried rice on lunch menu and the similar dish at dinner.  Husband loved the mutton curry.   Breakfasts were so good we didn’t need lunch most days.  

Mention of the dogs.  The dogs that are associated with the hotel are all well fed and looked after.   Nice to see.  We had one pup who adopted us and loved to sleep under our Loungers by the pool.  

One suggestion - would benefit from a little shop near reception for snacks, refreshments and local souvenirs like the lovely toiletries in the rooms.  Another way to support the local community.  

We would come back here in a flash.  A truely special place.
title: A top class and beautiful hotel.

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Karpaha Sands is a very special place. It is the only hotel within miles on this beautiful, clean beach. You can watch the fishermen haul their nets in at the end of the day, but aside from that it is devoid of the usual “beach traffic” that usually comes hand in hand with beach hotels. It is simply peaceful and perfect. If you are looking for privacy and quiet, this is the place!
The staff are fantastic and could not be more helpful. The tents are comfortable and very clean - although be ready for the occasional harmless spider or frog to join you. The food in the restaurant is exceptional and has very large portions. You will not go hungry or get bored with the wide selection of options. My teen boys were satisfied with the internet coverage as well. 
We can’t wait to go back!
title: Simply perfect

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir verbrachten acht sehr angenehme Tage in diesem einzigartigen Hotel mit zeltartigen Villen im Glamping Stil. Der Empfang durch den GM war sehr freundlich und unser persönlicher Butler, Malshan, führte uns zu unserer Gartenvilla. Uns wurde alles ausführlich und detailreich erklärt und gezeigt. Die Gartenvilla (Zelt Villa)  liegt in einem privaten Garten und ist sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtet, sowie auch sehr sauber. Kleinigkeiten, die wir benötigten, wurden umgehend von Malshan besorgt. Die Bereitstellung eines persönlichen Mobilgeräts für Wi-Fi und die Kontaktaufnahme mit dem Service ist eine ausgezeichnete Idee.

Die gesamte Hotelanlage ist super stilvoll angelegt und eingerichtet. An jeder Ecke finden sich liebevoll gestaltete, hochwertige Details und gemütliche Orte zum verweilen. 

Einige Anmerkungen zur Gartenvilla: Auf den Bildern der Hotelwebsite wirkt sie deutlich heller als in der Realität. Die Seitenabdeckungen werden aufgrund des warmen Wetters meist geschlossen gehalten, damit die Klimaanlage effektiv arbeiten kann. Dies führt zu einer geringeren Helligkeit in der Villa. Die verbauten Insektenschutznetze, die bei geöffneter Abdeckung zum Vorschein kommen, sind zudem recht löchrig, was die Nutzung in den kühleren Abendstunden einschränkt. Daher ist es in der Villa leider immer etwas dunkel und elektrisches Licht notwendig, was den Charme des Ganzen etwas mindert. Die Außendusche ist zwar wunderschön mit einem tollen natürlichen Garten, jedoch ist sie an den Seiten etwas offen, sodass sie von bestimmten Blickwinkeln vom Weg oder im Garten einsehbar ist. Dies könnte optimiert werden. Wer absolute Privatsphäre erwartet, sollte dies berücksichtigen. 

Die Speisenauswahl im Restaurant ist wirklich ausgezeichnet und bietet eine große Vielfalt. Auch für vegetarische und vegane Gäste wird ein umfangreiches Angebot bereitgestellt. Auch die Dessertauswahl ist hervorragend und die Getränkekarte sehr gut sortiert. Hier bleiben keine Wünsche offen. 

Ob Meeresfrüchte, Fleischgerichte oder vegetarische Optionen – jedes Gericht hat uns ausgezeichnet gut geschmeckt und wurde mit viel Sorgfalt und handwerklichem Geschick zubereitet.

Das gesamte Personal der Anlage war uns gegenüber stets überaus freundlich und hilfsbereit – vielen Dank an alle! 

Der Infinity-Pool in der Nähe des Restaurants ist der schönste Hotelpool, den wir je erlebt haben. Normalerweise nutzen wir bei einem direkten Meerzugang nie den Pool oder den Poolbereich. Hier haben wir jedoch wunderschöne Nachmittage verbracht, das angenehme Wasser und den Service der Kellner genossen, die uns mit köstlichen Cocktails (fantastisch gemixt vom Barmann Nadji) und Snacks versorgt haben :)  Der Ausblick auf den Strand und das Treiben der lokalen Fischer ist einzigartig.

Bezüglich der Fischer und des Strandes: Auf beiden Seiten des Hotelstrandes haben die Fischer ihre lokalen Basen. Man kann sie täglich beim Herausfahren, Wiederanlegen und Einholen ihres Fangs beobachten. Das Hotel bewirbt diese Situation als romantische Erfahrung. Diese Empfindung teilen wir jedoch nicht gänzlich. Die Netze werden mehrfach täglich mit Hilfe von lauten Traktoren eingeholt, und Fischereimüll ist über den gesamten Strand verteilt, auch wenn direkt vor dem Hotel versucht wird den Strand sauber zu halten. Teilweise werden die gefangenen kleinen Fische direkt am Strand mit Salz bestreut und getrocknet, was für entsprechenden Geruch sorgt. Kaputte Netze, Plastik und allerhand Müll sind hier am Strand leider allgegenwärtig. Wir finden die enge Verwurzelung der lokalen Community mit dem Hotel und die gute Nachbarschaft wirklich toll. Im Sinne der Nachhaltigkeit wäre es aber wünschenswert, dass das Hotel mit den Fischern an diesen Themen arbeitet, wobei wir natürlich für die lokalen Gegebenheiten Verständnis haben. Die Menschen bestreiten hier ihren Lebensunterhalt, und die Arbeit sieht sehr hart aus. 

Die streunenden Hunde, die in Sri Lanka weit verbreitet sind, werden seitens des Hotels offenbar gut betreut. Sie wirken deutlich gesünder als anderswo auf der Insel und sind sehr freundlich. Es ist schön zu sehen, dass man hier ein Herz für diese Tiere hat. 

Abschließend möchten wir uns nochmals herzlich beim gesamten Personal bedanken, insbesondere vor allem bei Malshan. Er hat sich während unseres Aufenthalts sehr zuvorkommend um uns gekümmert und war stets für uns erreichbar. Sein Einsatz war der maßgebliche Faktor für unsere angenehme Erfahrung hier. 

Insgesamt können wir dem Resort jedoch lediglich vier von fünf Sternen vergeben, insbesondere im Vergleich zu ähnlichen Hotels der gleichen Preisklasse.
title: Karpaha Sands

text:
Wir haben hier unsere Flitterwochen verbracht und was soll ich sagen…… es war einfach ein traumhafter Urlaub.

Und dazu hat nicht nur die tolle Anlage und das leckere Essen beigetragen, sondern vor allem das Personal. Wir haben uns einfach nur wohl gefühlt. Es wird einem so viel Freundlichkeit und Hilfsbereitschaft entgegengebracht, wie wir es aus Deutschland leider nicht gewohnt waren.

Also wir werden diesen Urlaub nie vergessen und kommen gerne wieder.

placeInfo/address: Kimbula Thona Kalkudah Beach, Kiran 30000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Unbedingt alle sri-lankischen Gerichte, die das Hotel zu bieten hat probieren. Wir haben es genossen!
text:
Wir waren 10 Tage auf Sri Lanka und hatten uns bewusst für einen reinen Erholungs- und Strandurlaub entschieden. Das Karpaha Sands Resort hat alle unsere Erwartungen übertroffen. 

Die geräumige und sehr geschmackvoll eingerichtete Unterkunft mit Blick auf das Meer war ein Traum - die gesamte Anlage ebenfalls. Der Strand ist sehr breit und mehrere Kilometer lang. Rechts und links gibt es keine weiteren Hotels. Wer Ruhe und Erholung sucht, ist hier bestens aufgehoben. 

Für uns gab es noch 2 weitere Highlights: 
Das Essen - egal ob Frühstück oder Abendessen - war ein kulinarischer Genuss! Es gab zu jeder Tageszeit eine sehr große Auswahl an einheimischen/sri-lankischen Gerichten - aber auch Fusion und italienische Gerichte wurden angeboten - alles auf sehr hohem Niveau mit hochwertigen und frischen Zutaten. 

Ein weiteres Highlight: Der Service! Umberto ist ein sehr charmanter Gastgeber, der jeden Tag seine Gäste herzlich begrüßt und sich auch Zeit für ein Gespräch nimmt. 

Besonders hervorheben möchten wir die Aufmerksamkeit, den hervorragenden Service und die Freundlichkeit, die uns Malshan entgegengebracht hat. Wir haben uns sehr "verwöhnt" gefühlt - vielen Dank Malshan! 

Das gesamte Personal war unglaublich freundlich, offen und service-orientiert. Jeden Morgen bekamen wir einen extra Schuss Mango-Smoothie mit einem strahlenden Lächeln, nur weil man bemerkt hatte, wie lecker wir ihn fanden. Vielen Dank an das gesamte Team für den traumhaften und sehr erholsamen Urlaub. Wir kommen gerne wieder!
title: Traumurlaub

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful experience at The Mirage Colombo. We are truly delighted to receive your five-star rating and to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us.
It is heartening to know that our spacious rooms, breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean, and peaceful ambiance contributed positively to your visit. We take great pride in our team’s commitment to providing exceptional hospitality, and I will ensure that your kind words are shared with all staff members, including those you mentioned by name. 
We are especially pleased that you appreciated the culinary offerings from our Executive Chef Rasika and his talented team, as well as the impeccable service provided by Champaka, Priyantha, Gihan, Yasaratne Basnayake, and Ravindu. Your recognition of their efforts is greatly valued.

We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable stay at The Mirage Colombo in the near future. Should there be anything specific we can assist you with during your next visit, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Warm regards,
Wohara Dissanayake,
General Manager.
placeInfo/address: 61 Marine Dr, Colombo 00600 Sri Lanka
text:
I am delighted to award five stars to a wonderful experience at The Mirage Colombo where  I stayed for little over three weeks. It is situated on Marine Drive, it’s spacious rooms overlooking the Indian ocean offering breathtaking views of the sea and sun-set, a peaceful getaway from the city.   
I experienced excellent hospitality by all staff who went over and above to make my stay pleasant and comfortable. The staff at the front desk were friendly, flexible and attentive at all times. The hotel boasts an excellent in-house restaurant under the direction of Rasika, Executive Chef, offering a wide range of foods inspired by cuisines around the world presented with the assistance of many expert hands including pastry chef Nipun Nethsara and Anuhas. I would like to thank other catering staff including Champaka, Priyantha and Gihan who provided a swift and excellent service.
The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean thanks to House-keeping staff, Yasaratne Basnayake and Ravindu, making my stay a comfortable and pleasant one.  The Mirage houses a roof top restaurant with a breathtaking view of the sea and the beach and surrounding areas, and also pool and gym facilities.  I can highly recommend Hotel Mirage as one of the best hotels I have stayed in Sri Lanka and I will definitely be going there again.
title: Wonderful hotel with an idyllic seaside view - the best of island hospitality

text:
If we had known just how good this beautiful and relatively new hotel was before we arrived we would definitely have stayed more than one night.  It was fabulous in every single respect.

The room was amazing, two huge double beds and lovely bathroom.  A lovely and good sized infinity pool with views of the Mahavali river, surrounded by trees and greenery and amazing wildlife. Food was super and as ever, the staff outstanding.  Only ten minutes outside Kandy in a car and well well worth being a little bit remote from the city centre.  Would definitely go back and would highly recommend.

roomTip: Take up their offer of a climb up the nearby rock for an amazing view. Definitely need strong shoes, knees and ankles!
text:
This is not your typical hotel chain residence. Very much at the luxury end of the Jetwing offering. This hotel only has 26 rooms and was built 5 years ago. I am sure because of the quality of the staff it has remained as good as the day it was first opened. There are lots of staff, many of whom were training whilst we were there and very much under the gaze of more experienced staff. This never troubled us.
We had a Gallery suite which was fabulous - spacious, stunning view of the pool and river, jacuzzi on the balcony, free minibar and attentive butler service via a mobile phone given to you at check in.
Nothing was too much trouble at all and our only regret was using the hotel more as a base than somewhere to chill. The decor imparts a real feeling of relaxation throughout the hotel and you never really trip up on other people as you wander round. 
Finallly the quality and presentation of the food was highly individual, delicious and expertly prepared.
Will definitely be returning!
title: Flawless excellence 20 minutes from the bustle of Kandy

placeInfo/address: De Soysa Estate, Gurudeniya 20189 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Jetwing Kandy Gallery, A Luxury Reserve
text:
This was an oasis of calm in an incredibly hectic town! From the moment you arrive, you are treated to luxurious surroundings and attentive service, exemplified by a personal butler who provides what looks suspiciously like a 'burner phone' so that you can call them at any time. 

The room was spacious and well appointed with a balcony overlooking the river with a daybed on it. This was especially nice after dinner listening to the river and birds. 

The food was excellent and breakfast plentiful and delicious, with a good choice of Sri Lankan, European and vegetarian options. It felt nice to dress up and enjoy the fine dining experience. All of the team were delightful (including the trainees, one of whom nervously opened a bottle of sparkling wine, later admitting that he had never before opened one in front of a customer!).

The customer service was tested (passing with flying colours) when we left our kindle e-readers behind and they couriered them to our hotel.
title: Luxury from the start and including a Butler!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,

As the director of Lake Lodge, I'm absolutely thrilled to read your glowing review of your experience with us! It fills us with immense pride to hear that out of the six hotels you stayed at in Sri Lanka, Lake Lodge emerged as your favorite.

Our team is dedicated to providing exceptional hospitality, and it warms our hearts to know that you felt so welcomed and well taken care of during your stay. We strive to create a seamless and thoughtful experience for our guests, and it's incredibly rewarding to see that reflected in your feedback.

Our chef takes great pride in crafting culinary delights that blend French techniques with local flavors, resulting in dishes that are both delicious and innovative. Dining under the stars sounds like a magical experience, and we're delighted that you were able to enjoy the serene view of the lake during breakfast.

We're thrilled that you found our pool perfect for relaxation and that you enjoyed the comfort and beauty of our rooms, especially the upper-level room with its balcony overlooking the forest. Observing the diverse wildlife, including birds and a land monitor lizard, must have been a memorable highlight of your stay.

Thank you for choosing Lake Lodge for your Sri Lankan getaway, and we're honoured that you consider us your dream destination for future visits to this beautiful country. We look forward to welcoming you back with open arms and creating even more unforgettable memories together. Until then, safe travels and warm regards from all of us at Lake Lodge!

Thank you,
Pulasthi Nanayakkara
Director
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed in 6 different hotels in Sri Lanka and Lake Lodge was our favourite. 

The owner and staff were so welcoming and looked after us very well and thoughtfully with minimum fuss. 

The food was great, the chef has some good french techniques up his sleeve (learnt from the owner he said) which made for some delicious fusion dishes and some wonderful deserts. 

We dined under the stars each of our 5 nights. We enjoyed the view of the lake at breakfast. 

The pool is perfect. 

The rooms are also very nice. We had an upper level room with a lovely balcony overlooking the forest. We saw lots of birds and a land monitor lizard. 

I also had a very good massage, at an extremely reasonable price. 

All in all a wonderful stay. This is where I dream of returning to when I think of Sri Lanka.
title: A really great, welcoming hotel

placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
text:
Im Lake Lodge Boutique Hotel in Kandalama angekommen, wurden wir von Gastgeber Michel und seinem Team herzlich empfangen. Jeder Wunsch wurde erfüllt, unabhängig zu welcher Tageszeit. Das Zimmer und Bad sind sauber und zweckmässig eingerichtet und die Klimaanlage sorgt für angenehme Kühle. Der Sonnenuntergang lässt sich vom Balkon aus mit oder ohne einen Drink erleben.

Das Abendessen war umwerfend gut und schön angerichtet. Der Koch zauberte täglich neue leckere Kreationen. Eine wahrhaft hohe Haut Cuisine verwöhnte uns. Auch die Weinauswahl lässt sich sehen. 
Das Vogelgezwitscher begleitete uns beim ausgiebigen Frühstück.

Um zu chillen liessen wir uns am grossen Pool nieder. Unser 4-tägige Aufenthalt hätten wir gerne um einige Tage verlängert.
Danke Michel und seinem Team für die nette Gastfreundschaft.
title: Grandioses Hotel, toller Gastgeber samt Team

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for your thoughtful and detailed review! We’re so happy to hear that you had a memorable stay with us at Lake Lodge. It’s great that the peaceful surroundings and warm welcome by Michel and our team made such a positive impression. We’re glad you enjoyed the spacious room with its French influences, the relaxing pool, and the nearby cultural sites like Sigiriya and the Dambulla Cave Temples.

The foot massage with the nibbling fish sounds like an unforgettable experience! We’re also thrilled that you enjoyed the meals, served by the pool, and that Michel’s presence added a fun touch to your stay.

Thank you for highly recommending us, and we would love to welcome you back for a longer stay next time!

Thank you,
Pulasthi Nanayakkara
placeInfo/address: Wewa Road 16 Division, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book a massage to ease the muscles after your early morning climb up Sigiriya.
text:
The hotel isn’t visible from the road so we were wondering what to expect as we drove up the steep drive. At the top, we were warmly greeted by the owner, Michel, and his staff who soon whisked the luggage away to our large room with balcony. There were definitely a few French influences in the room.
With a limited number of guests in only 10 rooms, there is a sense of peace around the 20m swimming pool. The hotel is just a few kilometres from Sigiriya and the Dambulla Cave Temples so you should be able to fit in some leisure time in the heat of the day after a couple of early morning starts. The massages are great value.
For a small donation to the local children’s orphanage, guests can enjoy a foot massage in a tank of small, nibbling fish. It is quite an odd sensation, but not unpleasant.
Breakfast and dinner are served at tables set out along one side of the pool. In a land where it is possible to eat some delightful meals, each course really stood out.
Michel is a lot of fun, and always seems close by for a chat, although he’s never intrusive.
We would have stayed much longer than just a couple of nights, but such is life on a quick tour of Sri Lanka.
This hotel is highly recommended.
title: This little gem really stands out

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
As a solo traveler, being able to trust in one aspect of your adventure is priceless. Well imagine being able to trust in an entire team of kind, knowledgeable, loving, and thoughtful individuals. That is the team at The Surfer, Sri Lanka. My gratitude for each member of The Surfer runs deep. I can honestly say my life will forever be changed for the better after my experience here. 

I have so much love for all of them, so brace yourself as this is about to be a long winded review. 

When you first arrive at the surfer, you are greeted by one of two warm security guards. They do their job but it doesn’t feel like ‘security’ is needed as everyone is respectful of one another around here. Then you’ll climb 3 flights of stairs. Along the way you feel welcomed by the always smiling house keeping and maintenance team. These guys are always hard working and know everything to make it possible for the surf camp to run smoothly. There’s a whole team of these guys that are doing things behind the screen to make each day easy for the guests of the surfer. 

Once you reach the stunning and tranquil upstairs floor, you’ll be greeted by an array of wonderful people and the sweetest dog darling. At check-in you meet the surfer hype girl Elise. By day she is front of house and by night she brings the party. You’ll also meet Damith at check-in, whose gentleness makes you immediately comfortable. And if you’re really really lucky, on arrival you get checked in by Hansa. Hansa is wise and his soul is so beautiful it lights up the sky. 

Before I go deeper into the team, I must call attention to the amazing food at the Surfer. The kitchen team works magic from their breakfasts to the special dinners. So yummy, so delicious. You can trust the food here and you will enjoy every bite. 

Now the volunteers… 
Melanie, the on staff yoga instructor. So nice and caring. 
Maya, an unforgettable Aussie. Her smile lights up the room and she makes being a beginner surfer so fun. Lean into her cheeky nature and you’ll have a great time, even when you’re swallowing salt water as a baby surfer. 
Romney, another unforgettable Aussie. Her kindness and delicious coffees will make you never want to leave the tranquilly of the upstairs. 
Emily and Matty- if you want to know the technical aspects of surfing, listen to these two. Matty and Emily both teach important surf theory, and they make learning and applying it so much fun. 

The founder of the surfer is a strong stoic man named Larihu. How Larihu pulls off all the coordination and logistics of camp is pure magic. If you want an honest suggestion, recommendation or opinion go to Larihu. He’s always kind and truthful but professional at the same time. Larihu is a true leader, through and through. 

I’m specifically leaving my feedback about the team of Sri Lankan surf instructors for last because I love these guys so much it makes me emotional. 

Nadiv, my little brother. From rooftop pop-up practice, to cuddles on the couch. Nadiv’s heart is so pure. He so much fun to surf with and he’s a bit silly so if you’re like me, he helps you remember to have fun. 
Bunny, he’s the fun fun. Another great surfer that relieves some of the stressors of surfing with his big smile and contagious giggle. 
Kusa and Reshan, when you’re in the water with these two guys you feel safe. They’re such strong surfers you know you are in good hands. 

Lastly, and certainly not least, Sohan. Here he is call Supiri Sohan, which means super or supreme. This is an understatement. True, Sohan has magical supreme powers. But his power as a surfer, and a surf instructor is only half the story. His knowledge about people, how they think and how they learn is so strong. He’s so smart, a bit shy and his heart is massive. 

In closing, if you want to learn about surfing, how to surf, and discover more about yourself, go to The Surfer. Trust in the process, listen to the guidance of your instructors and you’ll become a surfer.
title: Trust in The Surfer

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Tribe Yala with some friends and their kids, and it was nothing short of extraordinary. Nestled deep inside the Yala forest, this unique hotel offers an immersive experience that beautifully blends nature with comfort and exceptional hospitality.

From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the warm and attentive service — a special mention must go to Bandara, who went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. The food was absolutely delicious, with a variety of flavorful dishes that kept both adults and kids happy.

One of the highlights of our stay was the safari organized by the hotel. We were incredibly lucky to spot a majestic tusker, a few elusive leopards, and even a sloth bear on the same trip! Seeing all three of these rare animals in one safari was a truly unforgettable and rare experience.

After a thrilling day in the wild, returning to the calm and cozy ambiance of Tribe Yala was the perfect way to unwind. The setting, right inside the forest, gave us a true sense of adventure while still offering all the comforts of a top-notch hotel.

We wholeheartedly recommend Tribe Yala to anyone looking for a memorable wildlife getaway with amazing service, great food, and the magic of Yala right at your doorstep. We can’t wait to return!
title: An Unforgettable Wildlife Getaway at Tribe Yala!

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Not for anyone with a disability or those that hate crappy crawlies.
text: A wonderful rustic luxury glamping experience. We choose to stay in a luxury tent because we didn’t want it to feel like any old hotel and we were not disappointed. The rooms were spacious, clean and had all the amenities you needed eg plugs, fridge, toilet, shower, hot tub, WiFi. The staff were amazing they literally could not do enough for you, soooo attentive and helpful. Breakfast was served up high on a treetop platform which was amazing and our evenings meals were really tasty considering we were in the middle of nowhere. The cocktails were fab too. Only downside is the journey to the hotel after a safari drive, it was an extra 30 mins so if you are older or have a disability this place might not be for you. Also if you don’t like having geckos, insects, frogs etc in your room then I recommend you stay in a hotel. But if you want something different with 5 star service then this is the place for you.
title: A wonderful glamping experience with 5 star service. Staff and rooms are fantastic.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Utterly magical night near Yala. Wonderful spacious room with plenty of well thought out little things eg mosquito spray, universal plug adaptor etc. massive and very comfy beds.

Breakfast on the 'sky deck' was a trip highlight for us. Thank you Tribe Yala!
title: Special luxury option near Yala

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed three nights at Tribe Yala. Our deluxe tent (“Sloth Bear”) was quite large, featured a small external Jacuzzi and offered very good privacy. This property is run as a kind of “100% WhatsApp shop” as the staff almost exclusively comunicate with this app. Unfortunately - spoiler alert - we have no use for WhatsApp, but nevertheless managed to survive. Be aware, though, that the lobby is usually manned just for arrivals & departures, there is no phone in the room to contact staff and some staff struggle with english. The property is very nice, completely immersed in the jungle. Arrival is tough (half hour ride on gravel & really bumpy road from the agreed meeting point), wild animals do roam around in the night, paths occasionally get flooded during downpours and quite sizable frogs mysteriously somehow found their way into our bathroom (we freed 6 of them during our stay). Weather permitting breakfast is served on a a scenic tree canopy and dinner usually is served in the open in front of a burning log. Food was really good, service was occasionally a bit slow and hesitating (the property seems a bit understaffed) but staff is very kind. Hint: while at Yala Tribe ask for a tour to visit Sithulpawwa Rock Temple, a nearby breathtaking and otherworldly ancient Buddhist monastery with over 2200 years of history.
title: Remote, wild and luxurious

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you don’t like sharing your room with little lizards and frogs, it’s best you stay somewhere else. These creatures are friends to us :)
text: This place is incredible. It’s located in the “buffer zone” of Yala National Park- this means essentially that any animal can come into the area immediate around the hotel. We only stayed one night on our honeymoon and the staff, location, food and experience managed to wow us. Our room had a private dining area on a platform in the trees. Outdoor shower with both hot and cold water. Clean, comfortable beds with cloud like pillows and mosquito nets. The private rooms are not air tight so little friends can get in and keep you company (frogs and little lizards), but this is part of the experience. You are amongst the animals in their natural habitat! The staff was so kind and helpful. They arranged a private dinner for us nestled in a nook between the trees on a sweetheart table with lanterns that lit the way - so romantic and magical. It rained the morning we left and the rain made the whole morning so relaxing and even more peaceful. Their food was delicious. Best coconut sambol we had the whole trip. The breakfast was a dream - well plated and fresh. I could not recommend Tribe Yala anymore than if I was shouting its praises from the rooftops. We will be back and we will be telling all of our friends!
title: Just outstanding.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
My friend and I had an unforgettable stay at Tribe Yala! We stayed in the Sloth Bear tent, which was super spacious and even had its own outdoor pool—such a perfect way to cool off and relax.

The staff were fantastic, always so friendly and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. And the food was amazing—there was so much of it that we couldn’t even finish!

The whole place had such a great vibe, with a perfect mix of nature, comfort, and adventure. One of the highlights was definitely breakfast in the treetops—an incredible way to start the day.
title: Amazing stay at Tribe Yala!!

text:

You can find 5 tents, with a lot od privacy. Staff is extremly friendly, they help you with everything. We lived in super comfortable big tent for 5-6 people with private pool, tree terrace. After we returned at 11:00am They served huge breakfast at our terrace. Dinner is An experience. It is served among candles in the centre of the camp. Dishes are very tasty and fresh. You can choose a la carte from Srí Lankan and international dishes. 
We loved that stay. If you find something special definitely come here :)

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Tribe Yala is a total retreat from humanity! We spent two incredibly tranquil nights in the Tussker tent, only seeing other people when we were so kindly and generously served by Bandara and his amazing team. Nothing was too much trouble - post-safari breakfast in our own treehouse, dessert back in our tent when our kids were too tired to stay awake at the end of dinner. Without us asking, Bandara set up an amazing candlelit private dinner for us in the bush. The food is really tasty, especially breakfast. 
The tent itself is huge and well equipped, and feels totally away from any other tents so you can imagine you have the whole place to yourself. 
I also want to give a massive shout out to “T-Rex”, our safari guide. Request him if you can. He is so passionate and knowledgeable about all the wildlife, not just the big leopard chase that everyone seems to go crazy for in Yala (but he also showed us a leopard!). Thanks to his enthusiasm, we saw a baby elephant, a pregnant elephant, mongeese, a golden coyote, black necked stork and Indian pitta (both very rare to spot), a samba deer as well as the usual sightings of spotted deer and crocodiles. Our driver (sorry not to get his name) was really committed to getting us in the best spots without making us feel unsafe or part of the wild frenzy. 
It feels like such a special treat staying here, one we will never forget. Thank you.
title: Escape the world!

Thank you for your kind review. We are delighted to hear that your stay, from check-in to checkout, was a memorable one. It’s great to know that you enjoyed the breathtaking views, unique interiors, and the fascinating history of our property. We are also pleased to hear that the dinner experience and vegetarian options met your expectations, and that our colleague Krishnaveni and the team made your tea plucking experience special.

Heritance Tea Factory
placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay here atleast for 2 nights and spend 1 whole day at the property.
text:
The entire experience right from check in to checkout is perfect. We stayed for 2 nights and the team was kind to allot us a bigger room to accommodate extra bed for our kid. The view from room and property breathtaking. I couldn't have imagined a 100plus years old tea factory to have this amazing unique interiors and what was fascinating wa their old machines still working. 
The dinner experience is very unique where they have curated beautiful menu. Being a vegetarian, we were happy to see so many options. We also went for tea plucking, where krishnaveni and names gave was a warm welcome and showed us arround. 
Special shout out to the restaurant team- Nethmi,  Nobert, Vijay,Thanushan, Imantha for making this experience extra special.
I would highly recommend this place.
title: Best experience, highly recommend

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest 
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback! We’re so glad you enjoyed the unique charm of the Heritance Tea Factory, from the historical setting to the breathtaking views. It’s wonderful to hear that our colleagues  R. Thanushan and Pathmaraj made your stay even more memorable with their exceptional service and tour. We also appreciate your feedback on the food and staffing, which we will certainly take into consideration for improvements. Despite the remote location, we're happy you could experience the peaceful surroundings. We hope to welcome you again soon!
Warm Regards 
General Manager
Heritance Tea Factory
placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Parking available, very narrow road - two cars cannot pass only Tuk-tuks. Its location is out of the way.
text:
The Heritance Tea Factory is a special experience, it's like walking back in time.
It is situated on top of a hill with spectacular views of the surrounding countryside and tea plantations.
The facade of the building is as it was when built. The interior has had a refurbishment and the accommodation rooms made bigger from the original but still in style with the original.
Staff are attentive with immaculate uniforms and always helpful.
R. Thanushan in the Hethersett Bar went over and above with his service.
Pathmaraj has been with the Heritance for 29 years and gave us a wonderful tour of the gardens under his control.
Absolutely immaculate.
The downside is the hotel is in the middle of nowhere with a very narrow road leading to it. Unless you had access to a tuk-tuk you are stuck there. The accommodation was included in our trip however the food was very expensive for the quality and quantity. Hotel very over staffed as well.
title: Stepping back in time

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest, 
Greetings from Araliya Green City - Nuwara Eliya!
Thank you very much for taking the time to share your detailed experience following your recent stay at Araliya Green City, Nuwara Eliya.
We are delighted to hear that you appreciated our modern approach to hospitality, distinct from the more traditional inns in the area. It is wonderful to know that you found our hotel comfortable and that you enjoyed amenities such as the heated rooftop pool and the variety offered at the food court. We are also pleased that the adjacent garden added to your enjoyment.
We also sincerely appreciate your constructive feedback regarding the room layout and specific challenges with accessing the safety locker. Your comments are invaluable to us, and we will certainly review the room arrangement with our housekeeping and maintenance teams to identify how we can improve the functionality and comfort of the space, especially the placement of the safe.
Your observations regarding the ground floor lounge area and the cold draft are also noted. We understand how important it is to have a cozy and welcoming environment throughout the property, and we will explore feasible solutions to enhance the warmth and comfort of that space.
Once again, thank you for your thoughtful review. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the near future for an even more enjoyable and seamless stay.
Warm regards,
The Management Team
Araliya Green City – Nuwara Eliya
placeInfo/address: No 01 Glen Fall Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Different to the traditional style Inns and hotels in Nuwara Eliya, we were experiencing a place with modern concepts of hospitality somewhat similar to a city hotel in a commercial centre. Araliya Green city was a comfortable hotel. 

Room we were occupying was warm and cozy but a bit cluttered with furniture. Bath cum Toilet was comparatively compact in relation to the space in the room. We found it difficult to freely access the safety locker as it was placed opposite a large closet providing only a narrow space between them. It was inconvenient to open the safe due to lack of space in front. It would be good if this receives attention. May be the issue can be easily solved by moving this piece of furniture containing the safe to a more spacious area within the room providing better operating space.  

The concept of having a food court accessible from the hotel helped us to select what we liked from a variety of cuisine. The garden space adjacent to the food court was very colourful and attractive. 

Heated pool in the enclosed upper most floor was an important amenity which we appreciated but we found the lounge area in the ground floor rather cold to relax. Cold draft was regularly blowing in through the entrance every time the door opened and this area did not have heating.
title: Centrally located city hotel

placeInfo/address: 61 Marine Dr, Colombo 00600 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed two nights, separated by 10 days. Both stays were too short, the first one was coming from airport and leaving next morning on a bus, second coming in the evening by train and leaving at 4AM for the airport. Next time we hope to stay longer and really savour the experience. I am not sure how much we paid (tour group), but it was worth every penny and much more. Treated like family from the moment you get down from the bus. Excellent spacious rooms. Quick elevators. Enough power outlets. Bathroom was superlative. View of course!! Indian ocean across the road, rail track and beach. The 1st floor restaurant is all glass, looking out on the ocean. Excellent Buffet the first night and next morning. The second night, it was past 9pm and they gave us a Set Menu which was also excellent.  And when they found out we had to leave at 4AM they OFFERED to give us packed breakfasts, choice of veg or non-veg. Made fresh at 4AM, sandwiches, cup of fruit and a bottle of water. Everyone I said that to, said "Wow! THAT is hospitality!" Their motto is "Work Hard and Be Nice to People" and they really live up to that and more. We felt that we were leaving old friends, when we checked out. Really hope to be back. In some 60 years of wandering the planet, I cannot think of a handful of hotels that were this memorable. What would I want changed? Nitpicking here, but Vattalappam as I remember from the 1960s was less spongy, more coconut milk and jaggery flavor. Maybe time has distorted my memory, but that was one of my Must-Haves, and they had that as option the last night Set Menu. With the Buffet you don't have space on plate or tummy for much of this.
title: "Work Hard and Be Nice To People" is their motto and how they live up to it!!

Hello Andrew, 

WOW.......................................Reading your review just made our day. If we could give guests like you 6 stars, we absolutely would too!

Your appreciation of our natural surroundings means so much to us. We take great pride in our lakes, ponds, waterways and walking paths and yes - our 4 resident mugger crocodiles have become quite the sensation with all our guests. Our culinary team headed by Chef Ruwan, strives to create a varied menu with consistently excellent dishes and they will be delighted to hear your feedback.
I do hope you had an opportunity to experience our Curated Menu Offerings during dinner time. 

Thank you again for taking the time to share such a glowing review. Your kind words inspire our entire team to maintain the standards that made your stay so memorable. We cannot wait to welcome you back to your "home away from home" soon. 

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in a one bedroom villa with a plunge pool. It was perfect in everyway. It was large enough to be a home - in fact I would love it to be my home. The whole place is perfect, with lakes, canals, walking paths. Wildlife is everywhere - they even have a small crocodile in one of the ponds. So many different kinds of birds you could easily spend a day bird watching. The restaurant was good with so many choices for dinner, all of which were excellent. If I could give it 6 stars, I would .
title: If I could give it 6 stars, I would

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our 9 night tour of Sri Lanka. It was our first hotel of the trip and we were absolutely spoilt by the surroundings, room, food and service. I honestly wish we had booked longer here as it’s a real gem, full of wildlife but all the creature comforts you could wish for. 
There were a couple of issues, mainly with the noise from the peacocks at night! The only issue we did have with the room, was the tap on one of our sinks in the bathroom wouldn’t turn to cold, a minor issue as there are two sinks in the bathroom. 
Water garden would be top on my list to stay if I ever return to Sri Lanka!
title: A tranquil haven of luxury

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip:
Check alcohol-free religious days

Light sleepers may want to bring ear plugs (peacocks)
text:
Wonderful hotel set in highly manicured gardens with ponds and lakes.  Took us ages to get to the hotel from Colombo but what a lovely oasis.  There are peacocks and peahens everywhere (quite noisy at times) plus fresh water crocs , and loads of lovely birds including blue kingfisher - it is so lovely and the birds clearly love it. 

The ‘villa’ (bungalow) we stayed in (no 5) was very spacious and extremely well presented and very clean. Our bungalow had a small plunge pool. The room bar was well stocked and there were lots of little extras - the shampoo was nice which was a bonus, as I had forgotten to pack my own!! Doh! 

The paths leading to the main restaurant and reception are quite well light but there are torches in the room.  We felt quite safe and the fresh water Crocodiles are afraid of people and really aren’t very big. I reckon I could have wrestled them and I’m quite small. 

I slept really well but my wife was disturbed a few times during the night by the calling peacocks outside so bring some earplugs if you’re a light sleeper. 

The paths are made of fine sandy grit so remember to take your shoes off when entering your bungalow. And bear that in mind when you put your shoes back into your case. 

The food in the restaurant was excellent. We had no dietary complaints at all. And staff were good in asking how spicy you want you curry dishes to be. The staff were always polite, smiley, and helpful. 

The large outdoor pool was like bath water it was so lovely and warm, and a lovely view of the birds and water gardens. 

One thing to always bear in mind in Asia including Sri Lanka but there are days throughout the year when alcohol cannot be served. Full moon’s for example. We had one day (11th  February).  So check dates and pre-order beers for your in-room fridge before religious or festival days. 

We highly rate this lovely hotel. We strongly recommend it.
title: Wonderful hotel with so much wildlife

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
I spent the first 4 nights of my honeymoon at this hotel and it was trully amazing! At check-in we were greeted with a shoulder massage and the most warmest of welcomes, we then were shown our water villa which was huuuge. The room was finished to a very high standard and we even welcomed the ‘Marshall’ Bluetooth speaker for us to play our Spotify tunes on. The only item lacking in our room would have been a coffee machine of some sort (Nespresso?).

I had researched this hotel extensively before arriving, but I didn’t quite appreciate just how beautiful its setting and location is. The wildlife on show is so unique, from the peacocks, kingfishers, crocodiles, monkeys, even distant sounds of elephants. Unless I go on an African safari I doubt I will stay at such a unique hotel as this.

The food was fantastic, I was there on half board basis and it was 5-course dinners each evening. My only suggestion would be to chill the wine bottles a bit more as we did have a few bottles of white wine that were not the coldest.

The staff were sooo friendly, you can tell they have been trained to the highest standard (gardeners stopped and got off their bikes as we passed them, reception staff stood up to greet us as we passed them too). Special mention to our butler ‘Damit’ who was so helpful to us, and drove us to and from dinner when it rained!

If looking for a hotel in Sigiriya area, whilst this hotel might be expensive, it does not disappoint and I can’t recommend it enough!
title: One of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed at

text: The Water Gardens are magical populated by peacocks, kingfishers and many different birds as well as dragon flies. The rooms are generous and beautifully furnished and every detail well considered for a comfortable and relaxing stay. Our butler, Dilanka, was kind and attentive, swimming pool divine. Food was outstanding and Ruwan, head chef, prepared a magnificent Sri Lankan meal for us on our last evening. Our thanks to all the reception team and staff for a wonderful welcome to Sri Lanka.
title: We thought we had died and gone to heaven!

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Fabulous suite - large lounge area with multiple seating, mini bar, safe and a door out onto the patio with sun beds, chairs & table. Large bedroom with queen bed, desk & chair, ample space to store suitcases, wardrobe with plenty of hanging space & shelves. Large bathroom with toilet, roomy shower with nice toiletries, bath & double sinks.
We were 3rd from the end, furthest away from restaurant/bar/pools but had no difficulty walking - less than 10 minutes on the flat, through the lakes/paddy fields, enjoying the bird life. There are buggies to collect/drop off in case of rain (which unfortunately we had everyday at some point) & at night.
We were allocated a “butler” - we tend to think of a Jeeves-type character in wing collar & tails - in reality, our butler, Diman, was a lovely lad who set up our phones so we had the his contact details & he had ours, so we could always text when we needed a buggy. He also arranged for the mini bar refills & laundry. 
Very nice bar, with a top level that looked across the waterways to Sigiriya Rock. Lovely barman, Deepal.
Beautiful, large pool with sun beds. The waterways/ grounds are extensive & beautifully maintained. However, I wouldn’t recommend this resort for people with toddlers, as you would constantly be trying to keep them away from water.
The food was ok. On our 1st evening, the chef went around each table - we asked him about Sri Lankan food & he offered to cook us a special curry the following evening. It was good (although our guide felt the curries were a bit generic when we told him the next day what we’d had) - I would recommend if you go down this route, you ask exactly what you’ll get & the price… we found it expensive for what we had.
Overall, we would thoroughly recommend SWG & would return. We stayed for 4 nights & thought the extra night was a bonus for relaxing, after days at Sigiriya, Anaradhapura & Polonnaruwa.
title: Beautiful property in ideal position for the Cultural Triangle

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Mandy, 

Firstly thank you for having decided to book and stay with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed some aspects of the property. Please accept my most sincere apologies on behalf of the entire team for any dissatisfaction your encountered. To be very honest I was in-fact expecting this review as your driver did threaten the front desk staff upon departure that he would ask you to write a scathing review of the hotel. I am surprised and much saddened that having stayed for 2.5 days in the hotel, that you did not bother to bring to the attention of the Management, the stressful situations you claim you were encountering yet you were able to find the time during your holiday to post such a detailed explanatory review not only on booking.com, the platform via which you booked but also on TripAdvisor. Unfortunately this is not a very practical or helpful scenario for both yourself and us as this could have been discussed had we been alerted during stay and solved with a win-win situation for all parties. I have spoken with Diman, your butler in order to ascertain the other side of the coin and I also called and spoke to your driver whose account totally contradicts with what has been stated in your review. I invited him to come back to the hotel when he is in the vicinity so I could further discuss his accusations.     

I normally do not do this but for the benefit of future customers who would read your review, let me take this opportunity to respond to each point mentioned as some recollections do seem to vary. The issue at heart here is simply the fact that we did not offer free accommodation for your driver as he wanted/expected. We do not have and we do not provide driver accommodation in the hotel. We provide drivers and guides with all 3 meals free in our employee dining outlet and the front desk shares details of locations outside the hotel where driver accommodation can be booked. This has been the norm since the inception of the hotel in 2017 and no one has had an issue with this. Some hotels do have a separate sections where drivers are accommodated but not all hotels offer this as a default practice. I fully appreciate your concern about the welfare and sleeping arrangements of your driver but the implication was that we ‘threw him’ out of the hotel. Diman informed your driver that we do not have accommodation in the hotel and he was totally annoyed about this. He however did have all his meals in the hotel.    

CALLS DURING BUGGY RIDE - Each butler is allocated 5-6 villas and he serves as the point of contact during stay. Whilst driving you to your villa he did receive 2 calls from one of his guests which he had to respond to. He said the excused himself prior to the call and said sorry at the end of the call as per the norm.   

NEXT STOP HOTEL AT YALA – Whilst engaging in a casual conversation I believe you had mentioned that your next stop would be Yala Wild. As Diman had worked previously at Wild Coast Yala he had mentioned that it is a nice hotel. However what he should not have done is to make derogatory comments about your next destination which he confirmed he did and he apologizes for this mistake. I have severely reprimanded him for this and please do accept my most sincere apologies for this uncalled for statement. The young man now realizes the gravity of his comment and reassures that he will never repeat the same. 

DRIVER ACCOMMODATION ISSUE – Diman was concerned as to how you would react to the accusation made by your driver that he was ‘thrown’ out of the hotel without accommodation which is why he attempted to establish multiple contact with you in order to further clarify and explain the situation.

DINNER DELIVERY – Diman was the butler who drove the buggy which brought the food delivery to you villa together with Avishka and I was made to understand that you were seated in the living room when the food was delivered.  

WHATSAPP PROFILE PICTURE – All our butlers have been issued with official mobile phones with whatsapp facility. Diman had reported that his phone had dropped in the water during the rainy weather and we sent his phone to a shop in the town to be checked/repaired. In the meantime he had inserted the work sim into his personal mobile and was using it hence the reason why you saw his picture and whatsapp caption which reflects his personal status and definitely not his work status. This has been changed until such time he receives his work mobile. 

In conclusion, I understand from Diman that you had given a tip of Rs 2500/- and expressed satisfaction with your stay. In addition to this it was your driver who called the hotel front desk via the landline and said that he will instigate a negative review. This sadly does happen on occasions when a driver is not given all what he expects and it seems to be the case in this scenario. 

I trust that my response clarifies the situation and my sincere apologies once again.
Enjoy the rest of your time in Sri Lanka.
Warmest regards

David de Silva
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at Water Garden Sigiriya, and while the property itself is undeniably beautiful, my overall experience was unfortunately marred by unprofessional service from the butler assigned to us.
The resort is set in an idyllic location, surrounded by lush greenery with stunning views of Sigiriya Rock. The room was luxurious, spacious, and beautifully appointed, complete with a shared pool that allowed for a truly relaxing retreat. The design and atmosphere of the resort are exceptional, providing a peaceful and picturesque escape.
However, the experience was overshadowed by the behavior of the butler. Upon our arrival, he took us to our room via buggy, but during the tour, he took several phone calls in the middle of our conversation, which felt inconsiderate and unprofessional. He also gave unsolicited, negative advice about our next stop, Cinnamon Yala, warning us to cancel our booking due to alleged thefts at the property. This advice caused us unnecessary stress, but after checking reviews, we found no evidence to support his claims and chose to ignore them.
Things took another turn the next day when our driver informed us that he was initially told he could be offered accommodation, only to be later told this was a mistake.
 When I questioned the butler about it, he dismissed it as an error. I accepted this and told him that was fine. Later, after I returned from a tour, rather than checking in with me about my experience, the butler went directly to my driver’s car window to discuss the accommodation issue once again, essentially ignoring me. I was half way back to my room by foot when he then shouted after me. I started to walk back to see what he wanted but he only wanted to offer me a lift in the buggy. I politely refused as was already on foot.
To make matters worse, later that day, I received a voice note from the butler reiterating that the driver had been wrong about the accommodation. Then, that evening, when I ordered room service, the butler showed up with the server and asked my husband where I was. I came out in my dressing gown to once again have to listen to him blaming the driver for the misunderstanding. I had already accepted it as such and was surprised that I was being called and voice noted and now visited in person to discuss the situation again. This meant my dinner experience and evening were also ruined. 
What was most shocking, however, was that after we had left the resort to continue our travels, the butler called our driver to inquire once more about why we were upset. Our driver, understandably frustrated, had to block his number, as this persistent, unprofessional behavior continued even after we had left. The driver was equally upset by the treatment he had received.
Additionally, the butler’s WhatsApp profile picture had a caption that read, “I don’t have an attitude, I just have a personality you can’t handle,” which I found highly inappropriate for someone in a guest-facing role at a luxury resort.
While the beautiful setting and luxurious accommodations are certainly worth noting, my stay was significantly impacted by this unprofessional behavior. I also want to acknowledge the other staff members who were friendly and professional, especially Avishaka, our server at the restaurant, who made a positive impression.
For the price and reputation of Water Garden Sigiriya, I expected a much higher level of service. Unfortunately, the unprofessional actions of the butler overshadowed what should have been a memorable stay. I hope that management takes this feedback seriously, as the resort itself has great potential, but service needs significant improvement.
title: Lovely setting but sadly marred by one staff member

placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
Un établissement magnifique parfaitement implanté dans la nature Sri Lankaise. 
Véritable havre de paix au milieu des animaux, singe, écureuil, paon. 
Le spa et les massages proposés sont excellents. 
Les repas sont variés et très bon. 
Les habitations sont véritablement magnifiques (avec piscine privée)

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Louise, 

Wow, thank you so much for your wonderful review! We are absolutely thrilled that you had such an amazing stay with us. Your kind words about your accommodation are much appreciated too. We try hard to make sure every guest feels right at home in their private villas. The decks are especially popular for relaxing and taking in the views.
