placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
roomTip: There is walking along the paths to and from your accommodation, along the lakes and rice paddies - but with a buggy on call at any time.
text: Outstanding place to stay to visit the magnificent Sigiriya archeological site.  A truly beautiful hotel set in lakes and rice paddies.  A slice to calm and relaxation filled with a variety of birds - from elegant greater egrets to showy peacocks.  Our accommodation consisted of a beautiful little house with a large sitting area, huge bedroom and bathroom, and comfortable veranda.  The restaurant service was top notch, a very creative chef, and very friendly professional staff at all levels.  We particularly enjoyed Dilshan’s service in the restaurant - a combination of efficient polite professionalism.  And it was always a treat to walk back to our little house in the evening after dinner, alternating between spotlighting the local frogs and marvelling at the stars.
title: Perfect place to stay

ownerResponse/text:
Hello Roshan, 

WOW - we are absolutely thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your stay with us! It sounds like you had an incredible experience that truly exceeded expectations in every way. We are so glad our beautiful villas, scenic lakeside views, delicious dining options, and outstanding staff were able to create such wonderful memories for all 10 of you.

We especially appreciate your kind words about our unique amenities like the golf buggies, back porches overlooking the waterways, and even the peacocks keeping you company during walks back to dinner. Those little touches really do make a big difference in creating a special getaway atmosphere.

Thank you for taking the time to share such a glowing review. Your feedback means the world to us as we strive to continually improve and provide exceptional hospitality. We'd love to welcome you all back again soon!

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team
placeInfo/address: Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text: I have stayed in many 5 star hotels: there is nothing like this one. We were a group of 10 from the US. Each of us had a villa. We each had a golf buggy to drive us to our villa, along  paths that went by small lakes & waterways. The villas were beautiful & each had a back porch which looked over the lake, that had water flowers, birds & fish. You could call your buggy for the ride back to the dining area. We never did, because the walk back was so pleasant – we even had peacocks to keep us company. Each dinner was a 5 course meal: 3 choices for starters & several main courses to choose from. For one dinner, I ordered a seafood meal. Others got their plates of food: a main dish, with a variety of other items. Mine was similar, but then another platter arrived. Seems like my dinner had a number of accompaniments (see picture). It’s a lovely scenic hotel & the staff were outstanding
title: Amazing Scenic Hotel

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Lion beer and wine were the only alcoholic offerings here.
text:
I'm so glad I picked this little haven. The staff were so welcoming and the food was top notch. We stayed in the Eagle tent with jacuzzi plunge pool outside (which I made the most of). The room was bug free and clean but the bathroom smelt of sewerage (I hope this can be sorted but what would you expect out in the sticks). Each tent is completely separate from each other so you are completely unaware of any neighbours. 
We used Tribe Yala for our safaris. T Rex and our extremely experienced driver were fantastic spotters and really looked after us. We did not have to wait long to get into the Park. Lunch by the beach was wondrous.  (Separate review about Yala).
The breakfast in the treetops was a lovely ending to our two night stay.
We were pampered from start to finish. Strongly recommended.
title: Fun in the jungle

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Amazing experience. 

Villas are as per the photos. 

Service was excellent and everyone very helpful. 

Meals were great, and food options for the kids. 

Safari experience was unreal and very well organised by Tribe Yala. Yes, we did see Leopard. Thank you to Dinesh and the driver for expert advice.
title: Have no hesitation  booking this experience.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Life long memories created.Amazing experience with breakfast above the canopy and evening meal outside under the stars. The luxury tent/lodge had everything you needed. Comfortable bed gave us a good night sleep. The jacuzzi and outside shower (there was an indoor shower as well) were fun. We had a free afternoon and they arrange for a park ranger to take us out for a walk. Great for doing the early morning safari. We actually did see a black bear. It’s remote Jeep has to collect you from the main road. WiFi was fine. The staff were so welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble.
title: Life long memories created

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Set expectations right.  Spotting leopards on safari is rare—but there’s many other amazing species to ooh & awe over.   Bring binoculars!
text:
Friend and I stayed at Tribe for 2 nights during our 16 day tour of Sri Lanka.  For being in the middle of the jungle, the accommodation is very nice and rustic in the expected ways—jungle sounds are exotic while going to sleep and awakening.  (The cabins are screened on 2 sides).

Dinner menu had a variety of choices but I highly recommend the Smoke & Fire Feast if not going typical Sri Lankan.  The bbq chicken was fantastic.  

Breakfast up in the tree canopy was magical.  Dining on a huge, delicious breakfast (we opted for the Sri Lankan breakfast) while watching birds and monkeys at eye level in the surrounding canopy was magical.  The carmelized onion sambol was my friend’s favorite.  

What sets this property apart from most of the other places we’ve stayed is the attentiveness of the staff.  In particular, Bandara was so helpful and kind.  I asked if I could take a morning walk on the property and he took me in the early morning on a short hike to bird watch.  He also generously loaned me his bird book so I could familiarize myself with the birds.   It was Bandara who made sure our meal orders were in and customized to our liking.   He also answered our barrage of questions about wildlife and culture as if we were the only guests he had to attend to.  Very gracious.
title: Attentive staff sets this property apart.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed 2 nights. Was unforgettable experience. To be honest we didn't realise how back to nature it is, so you may meet a frog or gecko in the bathroom. Staff excellent as was the food. Amazing tree house breakfast platform with incredible views. Evening meals taken outside by firepits.
title: Unforgettable experience

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Start off very early (around 5am)  if you want to get into Yala National Park when they open.
text:
Very spacious and comfortable guestroom. EXCELLENT hospitality! Every staff we came across was very responsive and was nothing short of obliging, polite and helpful.  Lilan (the General Manager) definitely has a good team working there.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with them.

Weather-permitting, breakfast was served on an elevated platform built amongst the trees, level with the tree canopy. It was a wonderfully relaxing environment.  For lunch, we could choose to eat at the dining hall or have it delivered to our room. Dinner was served under the stars and by candlelight.

I would be remiss if I did not mention the F&B manager, Sudath Bandara. He is a constant, reassuring presence making sure all things run smoothly not only for our meals, but also steps in to help in logistics arrangement when Lilan is  not around.  Any request was promptly attended to.  A big Thank You to Bandara!  I should also mention Nalaka, another F&B staff, who is attentive and courteous.

The only downside is the location of the place. It is reachable only by a 15 minute jeep ride along bumpy tracks. (Ordinary passenger cars would be damaged by those tracks.)  The drive to the National Park entrance is about 45 minutes, with about 30 minutes of that along bumpy dirt tracks. We left by jeep at 5:15am but only managed to get into the park after 6:30am (including buying park tickets and queueing behind more than a hundred jeeps already ahead of us).

To sum it up, Tribe Yala's location is somewhat far to the park entrance compared to many other resorts/glamping places). But despite that, I can recommend it as a comfortable respite and for its outstandingly attentive and responsive staff!
title: Wonderfully comfortable stay, Attentive and responsive staff.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text: We had an amazing time here. The tent was spacious and very clean and the pool was great! The staff are very helpful and the meals were delicious. The treehouse breakfast was excellent. Would absolutely recommend this place to anyone visiting Yala National Park.
title: Amazing place!

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka

Book full board.
text:
Absolutely loved our stay in Tribe Yala, amazing luxury ‘tent’, the service couldn’t have been any more attentive, the food was fabulous and being in the jungle was brilliant.  

We did a full day safari which, despite the rain, was a wonderful experience.
title: Fabulous luxury glamping experience

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka

We are incredibly happy with our choice to stay with Tribe and it has been the absolute highlight of our trip.

roomTip: Remember there is a service charge and government tax on everything. Suggest leaving one tip at the end. This is shared among the staff.
text:

Reception and bar not permanently manned and all communications via whatsapp. It works very well.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir haben 2 Tage im Tribe Yala verbracht und hatten einen sehr schönen Aufenthalt. Wir waren hauptsächlich aufgrund der Safari dort, welche wirklich sehr schön war. Sowohl der Guide der Unterkunft und der Fahrer sind sehr tierfreundlich und nehmen Rücksicht auf die Tiere im Park. Man kann auch in die ruhigere Zone 5 fahren, die aber bei uns wegen des starken Regens unter Wasser stand.
Die Zelte sind sehr komfortabel eingerichtet, so dass man sich wie zu Hause fühlt. Hervorzuheben ist auch das sehr freundliche und herzliche Personal (inklusive süßer Hunde und Katzen), das sich alle Mühe gibt, alle Wünsche zu erfüllen. Das Abendessen war ein absolutes Highlight und sein Geld wert. Man bekommt 3 Gänge in einem sehr schönen Ambiente. Die Unterkunft ist etwas abgelegen, so dass es sich wirklich zum Entspannen in Verbindung mit einer Safari lohnt.
title: Schöne und freundliche Anlage mit toller Safari

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
This hotel is unique - a colonial era tea factory painstakingly converted into a hotel.  The common spaces are fantastic with many factory details left in tact.  While the rooms are slightly dated and could benefit from more power outlets, they had to fit hotel rooms into a tea factory.   The views are spectacular and as an added bonus, the grounds are still a working tea plantation.  Most meals are buffet style - we were happy with the selection, though a bit more fresh fruit would have been appreciated.  The staff are kind and helpful.  

The area itself does not have a lot of attractions, so you need to know where you are going and why.  If you like rolling hills, serenity, and tea (emphasis on tea), you will love this place.  If you are looking for action and/or lots of activities, this may not be the place.  

We were looking for the former, and Heritance Tea Factory excelled in all aspects.
title: Tea and History

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at this lovely hotel with excellent views over the tea plantations. Hotel has been converted from the original tea factory and has retained most of the original features. All the staff were brilliant so polite and helpful but a special mention to Nobertraja who sorted out my soya milk for breakfast and was so lovely and friendly. Krishna who showed us round the tea factory on the hotel grounds and Mohanraj who was on the front door and we had a lovely chat with. 
I cannot recommend the evening meal enough in the railway carriage which was such a lovely experience. The food was superb. The conductor and chef were  lovely and so friendly and helpful. It is well worth every penny the standard and presentation of the food was incredible. We also enjoyed the buffet one night and the live singing. 
Would highly recommend this hotel - it is a bit of a winding road up to it but well worth it for the views and the temperature is definitely a bit cooler here.
title: Heritage Tea Factory

We're so glad you found peace and tranquility in such a special place. Your feedback means a lot, and we hope to welcome you back for another unforgettable stay!

General Manager
Heritance Tea Factory
placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Heritance Tea Factory was like stepping back in time to the era of wonderful travel and accommodation. The hotel retains many of the features from when it was a working tea factory including remnants of machinery, a beautiful manual Waygood lift (elevator) with manually operated doors. The service and staff were outstanding - something not often seen in the modern era. The staff were all so proud of their service; polite; extremely helpful and knowledgeable of the history of the Tea Factory. It was like stepping back in time 100 years and we truely loved the experience. 
Turndown service was memorable and the effort to craft an elephant from towels was very special from our floor room boy Jayapraka. 
Sleeping with the windows opened and hearing only little birds twittering outside was truly special in a fast and noisy modern world. 
This is a wonderful place that travel connoisseurs would love.
title: Stepping back in time

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Long and beautiful drive up through the mountains and tea plantations to arrive at the shuttle point to take us to the hotel (tourist buses can't get through the narrow winding road to the hotel).
Absolutely amazing place! Beautiful views, stunning architectural conversion from a factory to a 5 star hotel (retaining a lot of the original industrial fittings - I loved it!).
Room and bathroom were very nice (bed was hard). Only complaint - no air con, only a very noisy ceiling fan. I know it's cooler in the mountains, but it was still warm (luckily, the windows opened and there was a cool breeze).
Food was very good (try the muesli, absolutely delicious!) and the staff were great.
Absolutely loved my (way too short) stay here.
title: Unique mountain retreat

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Dream visit, hotel delight and a wonderful 25th wedding anniversary venue!
The Highlands area is everything we hoped for, and the Heritance Tea Factory provided us with the absolutely premium location and experience.
Not only did we get to visit the onsite organic tea factory and fields, but the original engineering is in place, and running, which thrilled my husband!
We had the most magical wedding anniversary, including a gastronomic experience onboard the  TCK6685 classic railway carriage, complete with Conductor, personal Chef and live music, and a surprise cake just for us! The train even moves! Worth every £ for the evening!
A massage and whole body cleanse in the Spa, given by the wonderful Ari, was heaven sent.
The hotel rooms are beautiful,  converted tea factory spaces; extremely opulent and a great two nights sleep.
The Gardener gave us a personal tour of the English garden, which was perfect. There are plenty of hiking, tea picking and other activities on offer.
The hotel staff couldn’t do enough for us but we’d personally give a shout out to Sivakumar, the restaurant staff, especially the Manager, and our Room Man, Sajeeshan. Thank you for the best tea experience ever!
title: Outstanding experience and incredible location, hotel and staff!

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Our family of 4 (2 adult children) stayed at the Heritance Tea Factory in January.  As other reviewers noted, the navigation to the hotel is a bit tricky, but we definitely were rewarded by the view once there.  Our family had been traveling quite a bit, so we were looking to relax and enjoy the amenities offered at the hotel.  From start to finish, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.  We enjoyed the tea experience - learning the process of tea-making from picking to processing to tasting.  We also enjoyed High Tea on the terrace one afternoon.  Everything was delicious and there was so much food provided, we didn't need much dinner that evening.  Our favorite experience was the dinner in the train car our first night.  We didn't know what to expect, but the experience was beyond anything we had imagined.  The food, once again, was delicious, and the uniqueness of the traveling train experience was a delight.  We would like to express our special thanks to Gowtham, Nobert, and Chef Shanmugavel for their attentive care in anticipating our needs throughout our stay and for making this stay a truly unique and memorable experience that our family will remember for years to come.
title: Family 3 day stay

Absolutely gorgeous hotel - a converted tea factory retaining much of the original industrial infrastructure, but redesigned to incorporate guest rooms, restaurant, bar, etc. The views were magnificent and the food was excellent. My only complaint was the firmness of the bed, my back and hips suffered a bit, but it was worth it for the experience.

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text:
Great stay! The room was fantastic (sloth bear room). The  food and service was impeccable! They provided extra service because it was our honeymoon. title: Luxury in nature!

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We had the "Owl" tent
text:
We were a little scared at the prospect of glamping in a proper jungle, but we needn't have feared - Tribe Yala is is a seriously refined jungle property, with all the amenities the luxury traveller could desire, while also being eco-conscious in every fibre of its operation. 

You'll be greeted at the main road by one of the property's safari 4x4's, which immediately sets the tone of the stay. You're then driven to the beautiful property (which blends seamlessly into the landscaped) and provided a cold towel and fresh juice to cool you down, whilst you're given information about excursions and mealtimes. 

The tents are distributed sparsely enough to afford an absolute sense of privacy, while mealtimes were a fine opportunity to natter with other guests and share stories of the day's adventure, whether up in the treetop, or beside the bonfire. The a/c was top of the range and cools the entire tent down. While it is tented accommodation, it's luxurious, well-decorated and tightly sealed. Happy to report we found no bugs inside! 

Food is prepared to order and executed with aplomb - again, easy to forget that you're in the jungle! We recommend the Sri Lankan breakfast and the grilled platter for dinner (mixed fish and meat).

I am generally quite squeamish about certain things, but after day 1, I decided against the indoor shower and opted instead for a cold morning shower outside. An experience I would repeat again, and again. 

The other highlight of the property is the plunge pools, which every tent has - the perfect remedy for a tired body after a day's jungle trekking and safari.

Escapism at its finest and worth every penny and minute of time spent there.
title: We quickly relaxed into jungle life

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you have your own tuktuk you'll have to leave it on the main road at the house of one of the staff where it's 100% safe. They will pick you up from there by jeep.
text:
Had the chance to stay at Yala Tribe for 2 nights. As the hotel was quite full we had to stay in 2 different tents, Tusker which is a big family room with a private pool and outside bathroom, and Owl their brand new tent with a private pool as well, both inside and outside shower and a bathtub. The beds are comfy and the room itself is so cozy. Food is delicious, the staff is really lovely and helpful with anything you might need and they will pick you up by jeep from the main road.
There is a terrace in the property with a really nice view on the NP where you can enjoy your breakfast or some drinks for sunset.
Also, they organized a full day safari tour including the lunch by the river and what a day ! Our driver did a fantastic job and our guide explained many things to us and answered all our questions. We've seen all the basic animals but also 15 elephants, 1 male leopard and the sloth bear. Even though Yala NP is well known to be super crowded, which we were afraid of, the team of Yala Tribe got the priority line tickets for us to be the first to enter and we were the only jeep in most of the places we've been to. So a thousand yes to do the safari with them.
title: Wonderful stay

placeInfo/address: Kirinda - Situlpawwa Road, Uddhakandara 82600 Sri Lanka
text: Tribe Yala was our favourite destination in Sri Lanka. It had the best hospitality and food in a very unique setting. Our room was comfortable and we enjoyed our cool jacuzzi. We loved our treehouse breakfast. Our host Bandara was humble and generous.

title: Love it!

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Journey from airport approx 2 hours. Local tuktuks best mode of transportation. Plenty of restaurant choices locally
text:
We visited with friends who had stayed previously for a few nights whilst travelling around the island. On this occasion we made it our base and stayed 10 nights. The hotel had had a refurb since our friends stayed with a much larger pool being installed and a beautiful terrace and lawn area in front of the beach. 

All the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The hotel itself is decorated in a clean minimalistic style with quality furniture and linens. Our room was spacious and well set out, leading directly onto the swimming pool. Large bathroom with double shower enclosure, separate toilet and large sink and vanity area. I particularly loved the lightweight cotton robes and wish I had been able to purchase one! The usual towelling hotel robes are always way too thick and bulky for me so these were perfect. 

The breakfast was wonderful. A selection of fresh fruit and fresh juice followed by toast and a choice from the menu of eggs or pancakes plus tea and coffee served free of charge until lunchtime. 

We had a couple of lunches which were again very good quality but the highlight for us was the chef’s curry banquet which we pre ordered and was the best we had throughout our stay. Such a wonderful selection of dishes, all incredibly tasty and the curry was cooked to personal taste in terms of spiciness.

We sat and watched the sunset most nights and the view out over the beach was stunning. The beach itself is large with beautiful soft sand and is a surfing beach and as such the waves are quite big so as a weak swimmer I wasn’t brave enough to go in further than my thighs as some of the breakers are quite fierce. However the sea is lovely and warm. Having the fantastic pool to use means not having to brace the waves!

The sunbeds around the pool are exceptionally comfortable and complimentary beach towels are provided. 

All in all a fabulous stay and somewhere I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to anyone looking for a bit of understated luxury in a beautiful location. We loved the fact there were only 9 rooms and the service was very personalised.
title: Fantastic boutique hotel in a beautiful location

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: Small botique hotell only a few rooms. Service and food very good. Rooms were spacious and cleaned frequently during the days.  Held a very high class i would say compared to all sourronding hotel. The price is a bit higher, but its secluded and plenty of places to explore around. The beach is also 10/10 just outside.

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
This stunning hotel is THE place to stay on the south coast of Sri Lanka - it has perfect beach setting and is an easy walk into Ahangama for more cafes, restaurants etc. 
The design of this hotel is unique and we loved the spacious feel to the rooms and communal areas.  The pool area is stunning. 

Breakfast was a treat every day - the banana roti pancakes were delicious. Lots of fruit and yummy homemade jams. All the staff were super friendly. 

Highly recommend this hotel to stay for your Sri Lankan beach break, you won't be disappointed.
title: A stylish beach escape

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: This is definitely our favourite place in the south of Sri Lanka. We have stayed there many times over the years and even during COVID when we were sometimes the only guests. The place is always impeccable and well taken care of. The staff is friendly and helpful and the location is perfect.
title: Our favourite place down south

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
The Sandhaug is a fantastic hotel located by the best beach in Ahangama. It has a 30 meter long new pool that is just delightful. 

The staff is very friendly, the service is great and the food is amazing. Couldn’t have asked for more. Best and most luxurious hotel I have been to.
title: Amazing beach side hotel

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Mye strøm i vannet rett utenfor hotellet.
text:
Fantastisk hotell med perfekt beliggenhet på Kabalana stranden 🌞🌴

Hotellet er rent med flotte rom og uteområdet. Ekstra pluss for stort basseng. De ansatte er imøtekommende, hjelpsomme og alltid smilende. Vi spiste flere ganger på hotellet og var alltid fornøyd med maten.
title: Topp for familietur

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
Friendly and nice staff making your stay very comfortable. Room is good. Service is good. Food is good. 

The pool is above 30 m and clean. Very near the beach with easy access. 

Quiet place. 

One big minus: the classic brownie with a very good mousse is hard to not order every day.
title: Comfortable and friendly small hotel with good service and food.

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
I recently stayed at The Sandhya with my family, and it was wonderful. The hotel has stunning ocean views and a relaxing atmosphere. The staff was friendly and attentive, making our stay enjoyable.

The accommodations were comfortable, and the meals were delicious, featuring fresh dishes. Overall, I highly recommend The Sandhya  for a great getaway at Kabalana Beach!
title: A perfect beachside retreat at Sandhya

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: More than excellent, this hotel situated on the best location on the beach is not only beautiful but has given attention to every detail. The design is impeccable, the service always super good, attentive and quick, the staff is there to every wish always with a smile and good energy, also the food is excellent and the play list like all other details was thought of to make the experience perfect! Its my fifth time here and can’t wait for the next time and many more.
title: Best place in Ahngama

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: We’ve been here the 5th time and there’s a reason why: it is amazing here! The rooms, the house, the interior, the staff, the food and since this year THE POOL!!! It’s like the icing on an already fantastic cake 😍 We’ve been around the island quite a bit but there’s no place like the Sandhya and that’s why we always come back.
title: Best boutique hotel in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: We love love love this place.  There is no boutique hotel in this area that has such an amazing beachfront ANd new this year: an amazing pool. We have seen a lot on the island and keep coming back as there is nothing alike that offers beachfront access and a sea to swim in.  All rooms are amazing but the suite is hands down the most beautiful room. Definitely something for design lovers.
title: Love this place! Wake up to ocean sounds and enjoy the new pool

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: we have stayed at the Sandhya hotel for the second time and we will be back …its a great stylish small hotel (9 rooms)  in a great beachfront location. we love the moden and well designed exterior/interior its all spot on, rooms/restaurant, new large pool and nice sunbeds…food quality is excellent, service is great , staff is very nice and well trained, we are looking forward to our next stay in „The Sandhya“
title: perfect modern/stylish beachfront hotel

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: The Sandhya must be the most stunning hotel I have ever stayed in. Fronted right on the beach, the stage is set for a stunning vista, an infinity pool and a row of beach beds and umbrellas hug the Indian Ocean only to be interrupted by the odd fisherman or surfer. The bedrooms and ensuites are a continuation of the theme, allowing for maximum, light, beach and dreaminess.  The food was great and so was the late night fun with the board games and late swims. The only problem with the Sandhya is that you don’t want to leave.
title: Not just a hotel but a destination

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived at this stunning beachfront oasis in Sri Lanka, we were treated to an unparalleled experience of luxury and tranquility. Nestled along the pristine coastline, the hotel offers a breathtaking view of the Indian Ocean, where the sound of waves gently crashing onto the shore creates a perfect backdrop for relaxation.

The room was nothing short of exquisite. Spacious, elegantly designed with a harmonious blend of modern comforts and traditional Sri Lankan aesthetics, and the balcony opened up to panoramic views of the ocean. Waking up to the sunrise each morning was a dream, and the evenings were magical as we watched the sun dip into the horizon from our private terrace.

Service was impeccable—every member of the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was flawless. Whether it was a simple request or arranging personalized activities, they were always friendly, attentive, and genuinely caring.

If you’re looking for a perfect blend of luxury, natural beauty, and authentic Sri Lankan hospitality, this hotel is the ultimate destination. Our stay was unforgettable, and we can’t wait to return to this paradise.
title: Paradise in Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Book in advance as there are just 9 perfect rooms all with full ocean views.
text:
The location of the Sandhya hotel is perfect.  It's right on the ocean front! From our room (#4) we had a beautiful full view of the Indian Ocean and a one minute walk, if you are taking your time, to the wide open sandy beach! Sunsets are magical and the night sky is full of stars. 
The staff could not be nicer or more accommodating and the food is really outstanding!  The stylish, fully air conditioned rooms have high speed internet connectivity in case you want to stream movie!  
We had a fabulous dinner outside, with cool ocean breezes and signature cocktails!  Dinner was out-of-this World delicious! Sri Lankan rice with seven different curries and perfectly prepared chicken and fresh caught fish! Paired with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc from Australia we could not be more happy or satisfied.  
I rate our time there as an A+.
title: A relaxing beach oasis in Sr Lanka. The Sandhya Hotel.

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: Very welcoming  staff. Inventive and delicious food options. Unique architectural design and styling. We are repeat guests and have loved every one of our stays without question. The owner has recently installed a new pool which has to be one of the best pools going. All in all, a very well managed and run hotel!
title: Relaxing, hospitable, heavenly

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
We had an excellent stay here - Nuradha and team took great care of us. 

We were there for my wife's birthday, and they were kind enough to upgrade us to the suite. The facilities, room and common area are brilliantly designed and the proximity to the sea is a huge bonus.

Would highly recommend this place for a couple!
title: Excellent experience!

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed in this beautiful hotel for 2 weeks. What a beautiful place to relax. The hotel is perfectly located on Kabalana Beach, stylish, extremely clean. The entire team of the hotel was more than attentive, a perfect and incredibly friendly service. You can see that it is an owner-managed boutique hotel. Even the smallest details are very consistent, the motivation to offer guests a great stay extremely high. Thank you for this wonderful time, keep up the good work and stay healthy! 🌸
title: Beautiful place

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
It's probably my fifth time here! Stayed in December for three weeks, now going to return for a whole February or more... As always, very comfortable and relaxing atmosphere, nice people from around the world, good instructors, tasty food, waves are pretty stable. Staff and the owner are always helpful and responsive. Surfboards get renewed every year! 
For sleep and work I stay in TS2, it's more quiet there and you have a kitchen. Breakfast/dinner, surf and yoga lessons are provided in a main camp.
title: Second home

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
It’s the second time I stayed here and I would come again next year. The staff is amazing and helps you with everything you might need. The atmosphere is great and they really make you feel welcomed. The private rooms are large and really clean. They organise a lot of activities so there is always something to do. The location is not even a minute walk away from the beautiful Weligama beach ( beach break) and not far away from a big variety of restaurants and bars. 
The Weligama beach is perfect for beginners and for the intermediate/advanced surfers they offer guided classes and take you to some great reef breaks as well. 
All in all it’s the place to be if you are stoked to catch some great waves and meet some awesome people!
title: Amazing surf camp

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: Perfect stay to connect to interesting people from all over the world. Also perfect when you want go to surf - just few meters away from a beachbreak. Many other spots super close around that place. The manager is always up for a tequila & beer. So enjoy!
title: Always a pleasure!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you need Wi-Fi, they have it upstairs but  not in the rooms. So if you need it for work, then you might consider bringing a pocket Wi-Fi.
text: My family and I had a lovely time staying at the Surfer.  We are a family of 3 with a 14 year old son. We stayed for seven days with two surf lessons a day and we arebeginning surfers. The instructors were knowledgeable and encouraging. Thank you Susi and Ani!  The accommodations were humble, but quite nice. The food was good too!
title: Best family trip ever!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
Highlight of my backpacking trip! Booked 1 week as a beginner at the Surfer hostel and ended up extending an extra 4 days. The staff are so friendly and always up for a laugh and a good night out! The food is amazing and every couple of days there are special dinners with Sri Lankan foods. I found  Sri Lanka  as a solo female traveller extremely safe place, locals so helpful and always go out of the way to give you a hand or recommendations. 
Christmas Day here was very special and the team put in a great effort to make it a special day.
10/10 will return
title: Highlight of my trip

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
We have just finished a 4 day surf camp over Christmas and we didn't want to leave! 
Everything was perfect - Great price, great accommodation. Friendly staff with great surfing knowledge.  
The Christmas dinner they put on for us was incredible. So much more than we could of hoped for. 
Would love to do it all again! Definitely recommend regardless of your surfing ability, they have something to suit every level.
title: Amazing !

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: We have just had the best week at the surfer with some amazing people in an amazing location, staying in great accommodation. Kate and I booked the surf and yoga package and as complete beginners were really apprehensive about the whole thing but the excellent coaches quickly made us feel at ease and by the end of the week we felt like pros! The food was lush and the rooms spacious, cool and well decorated. The owner arranges something for you to do every night if you want to, with plenty of parties to opt into and 3 special dinners a week which we loved. We will be back!!
title: The best surf school and so much more

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
I had an absolute blast at the surfer, even came back again some
weeks later! always good vibes, surf and videoanalysis with feedback everyday but also the best parties (on a boat and all!) i think it's a great place for solo travellers like me but i also saw groups, couples and families enjoy themselves there. highly recommend!
title: Surfcamp

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
roomTip: Super green pasta for dinner was very very good! Highly reccomend!
text: This was a very nice surf camp, and we ended up extending several times. The camp itself is very beautiful with nice, big and clean rooms and a beautiful rooftop. The pool was a hit. Our surfinstructurs Rio, Kusa and Sachin were really good and helped us a lot! Big shoutout to Rio for several pool sessions after surf to improve paddling and turtlerolls. Surf lessons twice a day with them really helped us improve. Surf analysis everyday was humbling, but so nice to understand what you need to improve. Breakfast and dinner was very good, and we always looked forward to special dinner! Loved this place and all the people working here! Hope to come back another time!
title: Best surf camp in Sri Lanka!!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: Stayed in a dorm for 5 persons, very clean. Local guides helped me improve my surfing skills in a two-week surfing holiday in the first half of November. Different-level surfers and local staff create a home-like atmosphere & community. Transport with tuk-tuk to a great variety of spots. Tasty variety of breakfasts and dinners. Excellent value with an unbeatable price.
title: Enjoyable surfing community

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed a week in November at The Surfer and had the most amazing time. I consider myself a tough critic on hotels as I have a high expectation of accommodations & service and can report that The surfer is a great hotel, and learn to surf experience just meters from the beach that exceeded all my expectations. The Surfer is a modern and well appointed hotel with lovely clean air conditioned rooms, a great swimming pool and a friendly relaxed atmosphere. I opted for a single room which was very spacious and comfortable especially the huge bed with all linen and towels supplied. 

The owner(Lahiru) and his friendly staff did everything possible to make my stay memorable and extended there Sri Lankan hospitality at every opportunity which was both helpful and refreshing. There relaxed and flexible nature was great and anything required was efficiently arranged with no fuss or drama.

The food was excellent with an extensive menu of local and international choices along with "special meal nights" being provided  three times weekly which show cased the best of Sri Lankan fare which was a pleasure too experience and super delicious. 

The surf instructors were top level and went above and beyond to ensure that I improved my surfing skills in a safe and non judgmental manner with nightly video reviews of the days surfing sessions which was very helpful individually and entertaining for the group. There was also a Sunday surf theory workshop which was helpful and fun group activities and nights out arranged to explore some of the local sites & venues which was great for mixing with the other surfers and locals alike. 

If you are a seasoned surfer or just beginning your surfing journey staying at The Surfer is a must and you will not be dissapointed. Well done to the team at The Surfer for your high standard of service both in and out of the water and I will be back. Thank you.
title: Please don't risk disappointment! Book in at The Surfer for a very memorable experience

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
What a lovely weekend away! The Surfer Surf Camp was an idyllic place to stay for the weekend. Perfect place to chill, learn to surf and meet new people. 

Room was clean and spacious with a great view of the pool. Food was excellent and great location with the beach right near. 

The thing that stood out the most to me though was how amazing the people were that worked here. They make sure you have everything you need and are the friendliest people.

For anyone who isn’t sure whether to come and stay here, just book it, you will have the best time. Sri Lanka is such a beautiful country and I’ve loved the past four weeks I have spent exploring the country. For anyone who is worried about coming to Sri Lanka with the news, it is completely safe and everything is running as normal. 

I’ve just booked in for another weekend in a few weeks time as I already can’t wait to get back to this little slice of paradise.
title: Best place to stay

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: 10/10, would highly recommend visiting this camp for a fun experience and good surf teachers! Except for a good surf experience you meet a lot of new and social people. The perfect combination of surfing, yoga and party!
title: Best surfcamp

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: I booked 10 days at the camp but ended up staying 4 weeks in total! Good place for solo traveling, everyone is so friendly and social. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Location is good. It is surf right in the front of the house, but you also get transport to other spots if you are passed the beginner stage. Will very much recommend it!
title: Best surf camp!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: Everything was perfect. Nice rooms, owner, staff, lessons and food! Also a lot of different fun people staying at the camp. A good mix of surfing, yoga, partying and chilling. Really recommend if you want to have a very nice time while learning to surf!
title: Amazing!!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bend your knees 😉
text:
Amazing experience at the surfers. It was perfect for me as a beginner, the teachers gave me good tips how to advance to intermediate. The place Is also really good for socialising and making new friends.

The situation in Sri Lanka is not the best atm, but that was really never an issue at the surf camp. So go there and enjoy your surfing!
title: Amazing experience

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text: TheSurfer was simply the best place I could have stayed at and taken a beginners surf camp for a week. Lahiru, the Sri Lankan owner and his staff were extremely friendly and thoughtful and most importantly a fun group! There was a diverse group of other surfers there, from beginners to mid intermediates, but everyone benefitted because the Instructors were all experienced surfers (mix of expats and locals). TS is located just a minute walk from a fantastic beginners break and a few minutes walk from more intermediate breaks, and for the really fun (intermediate) break they took us out to Fishermans where there is an amazing gentle but challenging reef break. Overall, it was one of my favorite travel experiences so far and I can only recommend it with the highest praise. Stay Salty out there! Victor, April 2022
title: Amazing place to begin learning and progressing, with a super fun mix of people and experiences.

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
During my stay I had my best surf experience, best surf coaches helped to improve my surf level to the next level ! Thank you for everyone ! 

Atmosphere is the highlight of the stay , you will meet lot of new people during your stay ! It’s really nice and well organise surf camp ! I stayed in dormitory room ! Best value for money !
title: Best surf camp experience

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
text:
Go to this place if you are in Sri Lanka!  Best atmosphere and the perfect surroundings for a lot of surfing, yoga, relaxation, good food, new friendships and fun.  Everyone is welcome and the staff is top notch.  They have very good instructors with a focus on improving everyone from beginners to experienced.  Most importantly, you feel at home quickly and the staff will help you with anything.  

I unfortunately ended my week in the hospital after an accident but i could never have made it without the help I got from Lahiru (the owner) and the rest of the staff!  There are no better people ❤️ I can recommend this place to everyone and would say it is a must to go here, if you are in Weligama.
title: Amazing place with the best staff!

placeInfo/address: No 65 Wadanawaththa, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: The Surfer Surf Camp Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring enough sunscreen. Most sunscreen you buy in Sri Lanka doesn't work.
text: Had a great time! Surflessons every day, clean bed every day! Many great surfspots a few minutes away. The hostel has fun activities and game nights and the staff is super kind. I will definitely go back sometime! Very nice for people who travel alone because you can meet a lot of travelers. Thanks again for everything!
title: Great place to surf and meet people

placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
roomTip: We had two nights and wish we'd booked for more!
text:
We stayed for two nights at The Sergeant’s House, but wished we’d had longer!  
On arrival we were a little doubtful as The Sergeant’s House is just off the busy coastal road.  However, once inside the walls, The Sergeant’s House proved to be a peaceful oasis full of lush planting, including wonderfully scented frangipani trees.  The pool and pool area with dining loggia were beautiful.  
The ‘bungalow’ we stayed in was attractively furnished with good quality beds, pillows and linen.  Our outdoor bath and shower were a treat with lovely toiletries.  
Breakfast, lunch and dinner were all excellent.  We particularly enjoyed the delicious fruit plates at breakfast.  
We each enjoyed a massage whilst there, which were great.  
All the staff at The Sergeant’s House were very friendly and helpful, particularly the manageress who glided serenely around the house helping us with wifi and booking tuktuks.  
The hotel’s small private beach across the road meant that we could enjoy a swim in the ocean as well as in the lovely pool, which wends its way around the hotel interior.  We thought The Sergeant’s House was excellent and hope to visit again.
title: Beautiful, peaceful oasis in busy seaside town - private beach

ownerResponse/text:

roomTip: Try the massage it was amazing
text: It's hard to know where to start with this review. From the moment we booked the general manager sent me a personalised message. We arrived greeted by a refreshing cold towel and a tour of this beautiful hotel. We booked the grand suite for 8 nights and 9n entering it exceeded my expectations. The room is huge tastefully decorated spotlessly clean. The bathroom is beautiful and there is even a small kitchen area. The veranda overlooking the pool was a gret place to have our morning coffee. The grounds make you feel like you are in a tropical rain forest and the pool and separate jacuzzi are lovely. Breakfast was a delight and they adapted every morning to our tastes. All of the staff are amazing and friendly. And the general manager is so lovely greeting us personally every morning asking about our stay and if there is anything they can do for us. All the staff were a credit to this beautiful place. Ps the private beach is stunning feels like your on a tropical island. I wish our stay was not ending tomorrow. Would not hesitate to come back. Thank you for a wonderful stay and happy memories.
title: If I could give it 10 stars I would

text:
The best part of this boutique hotel is the house itself. Lovingly restored house of an army Sargent over a century ago. The furniture, landscaping, ceilings are from a colonial past and just lovely. This hotel has about 6/7 rooms only and has a small but dedicated staff. Breakfasts are simple but perfect. Chathuri, Indunil and Prasanna are gems! 
The beach is small, water is rough and swimming is limited. But from
Nov- Jan, water is more placid and other nice beaches are nearby.
title: Beautiful boutique hotel

text:
What a luxury stay at Sergeant House. Chathuri had great communication before our stay and was there to greet us on arrival. Driving through the large gates at the front started our stay off then with our fruit juice and our tour round the whole accommodation was great. We stayed in the 3 bedroom bungalow as there is 5 of us and wow what an amazing place. Everything was spotless pool/beach towel, shower towels, air con, fans, a bath, outdoor shower and a lounge sitting area. 
The pool is gorgeous, it feels very tranquil with the greenery around and chilled relaxing music. The private beach across the road is also a lovely little extra to our stay.

The staff could not have done anymore for us if they tried, very helpful and friendly too. The breakfast was wonderful, fresh fruit a choice of yoghurt cereal before choice of eggs or pancakes. 
Such a shame we only had one night to stay, but it will definitely be on our list for a longer visit next time to Sri Lanka.

text:
Ww booked five rooms in this boutique hotel during our visit to Sri Lanka. The hotel issituated in Unawatuna few miles south of Galle on the Colombo Matara scenic route along the coast. Easy access from public transport too as it is on the main road. The hotel is situated on the land side but they have a private beach - you just have to cross the road!
Rooms were very spacious and comfortable. Square pin plug sockets available so we didn't need converter plug. Air conditioning, Vapouriser and net available to keep mosquitoes away and as long as you don't keep the doors open in the afternoon when the mosquitoes are coming you'll be fine. 
There is a well maintained pool that goes around the dining area starting shallow and then going deep. If you have younger kinds or non swimmers keep an eye out when they are in the pool. Great home cooked feel Sri Lankan food. We enjoyed the food very much. There are sports equipment that you can borrow, Jacuzzi and lot of exploring to do. We had a wonderful time there and the staff were so polite and helpful. I have no hesitation to recommend this place. We will definitely go back

placeInfo/address: 381 Matara Road Ganahena, Unawatuna 80600 Sri Lanka
text:
We were looking for a villa for the family to go for the weekend and came across Sergent’s House site and wasn’t convinced looking at the website, called the manager and after getting the rate and menus we have decided to go there. ( I called them at 7pm the day before we planned to travel, after office hours, the mangers answered, and when I requested for menus, she sent me menus via WhatsApp) The villa was gorgeous, ( the site doesn’t  do  justice to the place at all) delicious food and staff made us feel at home. We had 7 adults and 3 kids, a 6 year old, 1.5 year old and a 5 months baby, and booked the family unit which has 3 separate rooms and attic. The beds were comfortable and room was spacious, one had an extra bed. It is more like a colonial house, has old world charm and modern amenities. Kids were in the pool most of the time and because there is a patio cum dining area facing the pool, the rest of the family too could sit and read and watch kids play and have a blast. 
We opted for Sri Lankan for lunch and for breakfast continental breakfast and seafood lasagna and bbq chicken and salad for dinner. Impressive that they even had hot chocolate for breakfast, and fruit platters with 4 or 5 varieties of fruits, juice and enough tea and coffee. 
The villa has a private beach just across Galle road, it is like you are not in city, and once you cross the road, the beach is gorgeous. The garden is a place to read and just do nothing and sit and look at fish in the ponds. Forest and beach vibes both at one place. 
Absolutely loved the whole experience and I proved that I am the best when it comes to planning holidays 😁 
I would recommend the villa to anyone looking for a holiday. It is affordable and so worth for the price you pay. And if they have availability they let you check in early and check out late, these small details matter me as I’m an inbound travel agent.  I forgot my phone charger and the managers was so kind to send it via post to me, and no I didn’t pay for postage. These little things matter to me, it is the people what makes a place amazing sometimes. Thank you team for having us and hoping to come again.
title: Family holiday

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: The Sandhya embodies elegance and refined luxury reimagined for Sri Lanka's stunning south coast. Nestled towards the (quiet) end of the stunning Kabalana Beach, The Sandhya is the crown jewel in Ahangama's burgeoning hotel and tourism scene. From smiling security and housekeeping to the excellent service team led by Taranja, the staff are unbelievably friendly, professional, and attentive in all the right ways. The food and cocktail menu are a culinary tour de force. Try the tuna tataki (ideally washed down with signature cocktails such as Sand & Sun or Gold Dust), it is literally my favourite meal in the world. The Sandhya delivers six-star-level confort, world-class design (wait until you see the iconic floating staircase) and landscaping, and high-end interior and amenity elements. No expense has been spared in ensuring their guests' receive an unmatched customer experience. Crucially, I don't say any of this based on one visit. I've stayed at The Sandhya around a dozen times over 5-6 years and the standards never slip, if anything they improve every year. If you can swing it, try out the Director's Suite - it is a genuine triumph in every way imagineable! Overall, the Sandhya is simply unmatched. It is a must-stay property if you're heading to Ahangama, which you should be! Oh, and the no kids policy may not be for everyone but it's a hit for me!
title: The Sandhya: the crown jewel in Ahangama's burgeoning hotel and tourism scene

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: There is something mystical about The Sandhya from the moment of arrival. The paradox of the imposing yet inviting, luxurious yet natural entrance makes you gasp and grin with expectation before you even step into the elegant interior. There are local touches everywhere...subtle but prevalent, all the same. The smiling welcome when the gate slides back to give access to your Tuk Tuk or your airport transfer; the shoes carefully lined up on the side of the stairs; the aromas and the gifts on the reception desk, the wooden key rings and the leather accessories. You know you need to check-in but you're too busy wondering when you will have time to photograph all the magnificently designed angles. More paradox...minimal, clean, symmetrical with modern-inspired furniture straight out of a magazine feature but cosy, warm, natural materials exuding comfort and that feeling of home at the same time. The boutique hotel's signature staircase allows the floor-to-ceiling windows space to breathe, and the stunning view is constant: day or night. Breathtaking! The concept is easy and simple but remarkable. It's a nine-room home with a lovely team there to make your stay unforgettable. But do they feel like staff waiting on you hand and foot? That would be too stifling, no. They are always there when you need them but this is more like being in a shared villa with friends (who you don't have to see if you decide you want your privacy). Open kitchen, honesty bar, a fabulous breakfast menu, lunch and dinner, board games, reading material, coffee-table books, a pool and garden, but - more importantly - a quiet corner of Kabalana beach, just metres from the azure waters and the waves. It's heavenly! The music, the daily fresh juices and fruit, the surf lessons (should you opt for some), the stretch of sandy beach, the access to everything else on your to-do list, the shared dinner or gatherings if you are fortunate enough to be there on a special occasion (like New Year's Eve with bubbles and fireworks) are carefully curated to make sure you build some unforgettable memories. You could be perched on the bar having a drink with the owner, running along the sand by sunrise, or lying on your sunbed chatting to a couple about their honeymoon. And, if you're alone, you will feel totally at ease doing your own thing in the lounge area or the dining room, tapping away at your laptop or reading your book, safe in the knowledge that someone is always around if you fancy a bite to eat or a refreshment, a massage, some tips on activities in the area or help planning your stay...and wherever you are in the hotel, you are always overlooking the garden and the sea. Magical! The Sandhya is a boutique hotel with a difference. It didn't feel like being in a hotel at all, but it had all the trimmings of a luxury resort. Sri Lanka was amazing, so being able to couple that up with accommodation I never wanted to leave, made every part of my itinerary a moment of anticipation. Did I mention lying in bed watching the waves or the gorgeous bath-robes and the super comfy bed? Too much for one review. I would go back in a heartbeat. Thank you for a great Sri Lanka experience to the entire team!
title: A PERFECT SANCTUARY

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
On honeymoon we ended up at Sandhya a little by accident ( also we like Telegraph recommendations) and what a good move!
This place is magical.
It is a very small luxurious hotel.
The location is absolutely fantastic right on a quiet, long, beautiful beach. Guests have direct access so no need to take anything when going for a swim or a walk. 
The beach is quiet but with all facilities including surfing lessons and hire. 
The hotel is built around its privileged location so there are stunning sea views from every room.
We stayed on director’s suite for our special occasion and wow! Really spacious room with to balconies with the most incredible view. 
Big comfortable bed, fresh white cotton linen, robes, double walk in shower and vanity, fabulous bath with a view ( salts provided daily), huge dressing area, several large mirrors, a/c, speaker, impeccably decorated, no effort or expense has been spared. 
The theme continues in the whole hotel.
The food is fresh and cooked to perfection. Healthy tasty breakfast is included. We did explore a few other recommended restaurants but the best meals were at the Sandhya’s restaurant. Do try the tuna, best we have ever had.
The staff are incredibly attentive, knowledgeable and professional and accommodate everything we needed: transport, recommendations, I had the most incredible massage in my room which got rid of all my muscle aches! It is a very personal service and this is a big plus for us. 
An absolutely magical time in a small,  quiet, stylish hotel that catered for every single of our needs in the most privileged location.
 Perfect as a romantic location or simply somewhere to recharge batteries. 
Magical memories but we plan to come back. 
Thank you 😊
title: Magical experience

A Gem on the South Coast!

My stay at the Sandhya was nothing short of magical. From the moment we arrived, we were enveloped in a world of luxury and personalized service. The attention to detail in the decor, the impeccable cleanliness, and the stunning ocean views made our room a true haven.

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
I primarily use Tripadvisor to give reviews on restaurants - but in this case I have to deviate from that, and write a review on this amazing hotel.

My wife and I stayed here for 8 days - and everything about our stay has been flawless.

The initial communication with the hotel was very serviceminded. Without asking we got offered a discount on the airport transfer, since we were staying for 8 days. Furthermore all our questions were replied very fast - we felt welcome even before arriving.

Hotel staff did an excellent job. They seemed to be at our disposal all the time - but still without being "in our faces". That is a fine line - and they certainly got that right. A lot of other hotels could learn from that.

Breakfast was from 8 to 12 - so no need to set the alarm to make it. Great menu with a lot to chose from. We had something different every morning.

The rest of the day there were also a lot of opportunities - varying from snacks, open sandwiches and nice smoothies to a great dinner menu with starters, mains and desserts. The kitchen staff never let us down - we tried to go through the entire menu, but didn't make it. Would have required another 4-5 days :) Every meal was absolutely stunning. The portions are great - and the seafood out of this world.

The overall feel of the hotel was really nice. It made you feel like you actually were at your own exclusive beach house - situated right on the shore. The fact that there are only 10 rooms in the hotel - and that it is "adults only"  - added to that feeling. There is a laid back and stressless atmosphere - amplified by the lounge like music filling the common/dining area.

Rooms are great - the high ceiling adds to the airy feel. A/C working great - and combined with the ceiling fan, there was never a moment we couldn't adjust to the temperature that we wanted.

Time to wrap up this review.

We are frequent travellers - and have stayed at a lot of 5 star hotels. Still this is overall one of our best hotel experiences - and all the above resulted in a 5 star stay. We can only give The Sandhya our absolute best recommendations - and will do so, to everyone who wants to hear about our trip to Sri Lanka :)

Thank you - look forward to coming back.
title: Book it - you will not regret :)

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
Questo è stato il nostro migliore soggiorno in Sri Lanka. Tutto al Sandhya è assolutamente perfetto. Accoglienza del personale sempre disponibile e attento ad ogni esigenza. Le camere sono di un livello superiore. Biancheria di alta qualità , tanti piccoli dettagli pensati per il confort del cliente degni di un hotel di lusso. Abbiamo amato la doccia doppia con acqua sempre calda (cosa molto rara in sri Lanka) e la cromoterapia. Tutte le camere hanno una vista sull’oceano meravigliosa da cui si vedono due spot di surf e la sera ci si può godere il tramonto dalla propria stanza.
La colazione è deliziosa e servita con grande stile. 
La hall è un capolavoro di architettura e il giardino con lettini di fronte alla spiaggia è perfetto per rilassarsi e leggere un libro. 
A questo posto che mi è rimasto nel cuore do il massimo dei voti e, alla mia quarta esperienza in sri Lanka, lo considero l’hotel migliore del paese.
Unico consiglio da dare: sarebbe fantastico avere un piccolo frigo nelle camere e dei servizi per thè/caffè in camera.
title: Best hotel in the country!

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
I don’t often write reviews but the Sandhya deserves one. This luxury boutique hotel is very fairly priced when it comes to value for money. The design of the hotel and rooms is classy and sophisticated but still makes you feel at home! (Or the home you wished you lived in ;-) ). Rooms are well equipped and also have stunning sea views! The bedding is super comfy and airco works super well. The staff are very friendly and willing to go the extra mile to make you feel taken care of. They organized our tuk tuks when we needed them, sent us to the beach with a beach bag equipped with beach towels and fresh bottles of water and recommended us great local spots. 

The indoor common area is spacious and full of books, magazines and fun games.

The breakfast that was included in our package felt like a generous four course menu and it was delicious! We also ate in one evening and that was tasty too! 

Lastly, the outdoor area is serene. A perfect place to chill and relax whether on the sun beds, on the sofas, at the chairs and tables or in the pool, all right in front of the ocean 😍! 

We ended up staying at the hotel more than we expected, because we just felt great there! 

Highly recommend :)
title: Highly recommend !!

The Sandhya
placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text:
The best hotel we have been to in Sri Lanka, even in Asia.
The design, the food and the service are all perfect.
A particular care is given to the cleanliness, the rooms are cleaned twice a day.
What makes this hotel exceptional and completely different from the rest is its service and the people who work there. The manager Teranja saved our stay in Sri Lanka after several disappointments in other hotels, he has always been of good advice and small attention that make the difference. A big thank you also to the two waiters Naveen and Dilan who show a great professionalism.
We will come back for sure, do not hesitate one second if you wish to stay in the South West of Sri Lanka.
title: Perfect hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr Michael,

It was such a pleasure welcoming you at The Sandhya!  We are touched you understand who we are and our ethos.  Thank you for your kind words about our little team and hotel.  It was such a pleasure welcoming and looking after you.  Special guests like yourself make our hard work all worthwhile!

We wish you happy travels and hope see you again soon!

The Sandhya
placeInfo/address: Matara Rd, Ahangama 80650 Sri Lanka
text: The Sandhya may be more expensive than the vast selection of places you can stay in this coastal area of Sri Lanka, but I can say with great confidence that it is worth the extra cost.  The property is like a really nice boutique hotel you might find in a much more developed place.  Sandhya is a diamond in the rough, but still remains authentic to Sri Lanka.  It does not pretend to be something it is not. The rooms are immaculate, the air conditioning is just right, the beds are extremely comfortable.  The rooms could not be more comfortable.  There are no children permitted at Sandhya and so it is an ideal place is you are looking to get away and find some peace and quiet.  I believe there are less than 10 rooms, so it never feels crowded, even when it is full.  The food is excellent, the lounge chairs are comfortable and the outside are, pool etc are very well maintained and beautiful.  The facility is an all around beautiful place with multiple surf breaks within walking distance.  All that said, I have saved the best for last.  The staff at Sandhya is one of the most professional, friendly and attentive I have come across in all my travels.  Truly, the staff at Sandhya stands out and made our stay an absolute pleasure.  They find the perfect balance of availability to your needs and letting you enjoy your peace and quiet.  They helped us with all of our needs and were problem solvers when we needed them, particularly around transportation.  In addition to all of this praise, I need to include that the restaurant right across the street from Sandhya is one of the best dining experiences I've ever had.  We were told by a Brit we met that it is the best food in Sri Lanka and I can believe that.  Perfectly executed dishes, great atmosphere and professional staff.  There were no misteps during our five night stay at Sandhya and it was truly a perfect experience.  My thanks to the staff.  We miss you guys!
title: A Perfect Stay

text:
On our way from Kandy to Heritage Factory hotel, I was mesmerised by the sheer beauty of the location and setting of this hotel. Surrounded by mist and low floating clouds made our arrival very special.

Check in was smooth and soon we were in a very nice room with lovely views all around.

We had our dinner at the restaurant in the hotel. We are vegetarian so were not sure if we would enjoy the buffet dinner.

Chef Balbeer, made us feel at home, clearly explaining all the different vegetarian dishes. Once he realised, we don't eat eggs, he said no worries and prepared rotis which we thoroughly enjoyed along with very tasty curries. Chef Balbeer went out of his way to prepare perfect potato bhajias, which my wife and I enjoyed.

The whole of the restaurant team provided service with a smile and would like to mention Ganesh for his exemplary service.

Wish ww had more days to spend at this wonderful hotel full of culture and past heritage.

We will have no hesitation in recommending the hotel and chef Balbeer and his team to all our friends and family in UK
title: Heritage hotel with outstanding customer service

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: It’s a beautiful property perched on hilltop in salubrious surroundings. A more than 100 year old erstwhile English tea factory, very mindfully converted into a hotel, exuding Brit culture to the T , it offers you glimpses of what the past was like. Equipped with modern amenities, it has curious remnants of the past as well in the form of the generator and mower, among other things. The spa is nice, Indah is a wonderful masseuse. The staff is very mindful of your needs, we were very well looked after by the ever-smiling restaurant overseer Agra.
title: Journey into the past

placeInfo/address: Kandapola, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You might need a fleece or cardigan… it can get cool when the clouds and mist descend.
text: This is a fascinating hotel high up in the hills near Nuwara Eliya, converted from a former tea factory and still with working machinery which is switched on every evening for the benefit of guests! From the old-fashioned lift to the traditional Hethersett bar and restaurant, this place is full of history and the photos and explanatory texts on the walls make for interesting reading. You can even book dinner in an adjacent railway carriage (tasting menu). The mini-tea factory and gardens in the grounds are worth exploring… but beware the clouds can descend in a matter of minutes!
title: An atmospheric hotel in tea country

Spend some money on this old grand dame and it would be amazing . As it is right now it’s just ok .

Quiet location in the middle of a tea plantation about 30 minutes drive from Nuwara Eliya. 
Hotel had an age old charm retaining many of its colonial era features. 
Carpeted and so mostly quiet at night apart from the occasional creaking with guests coming and going. 
Good wifi and water supply. 
We needed to use the heater at night but a comfy nights sleep otherwise with blackout curtains. Thank you Patmanathan for keeping our room clean and stocked up. 
The grounds are well maintained and they have a lovely small garden. 
They have tea tasting, nature walks, Horton Park guided walks as options for those interested. 
The Spa had good options too and is very reasonably priced. 
Highly recommended if you are staying in the area.
title: Hotel in the middle of a tea plantation.

text: We stayed here for two nights, one of our group needs gluten free food. The views are just stunning, the hotel is a cool mixture of old and new, sitting outside in the sunshine on the lovely lawns with a good drink or two, overlooking tea plantations is just great. We did their tea picking/tasting experience and those ladies really know their stuff ( we were educated by Jayanthi). In the restaurant, the chef is very aware of being coeliac, so an eat and don’t eat tour was clear and they even specially prepared a platter of meats and fish that was exceptional. placeInfo/address: Pamunugama Rd, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a truly memorable stay at this beautiful property. The highlight was definitely the pools — a stunning 100-meter pool and a gorgeous infinity pool, both perfect for relaxing and soaking in the views.

The staff were incredibly warm and attentive. A special shoutout to Imashi, who looked after every little detail and made our stay feel extra special. Dinner by Chef Thiran Fernando was a standout — he customized the meal to our taste and it turned out to be one of the best meals of our entire trip.

Another unique experience was the Ayurvedic consultation with their in-house doctor before our wellness session. It added a deeply personal and thoughtful touch, and made the whole experience feel truly holistic and rejuvenating.

Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a luxurious, healing, and heartfelt escape.
title: A Perfect Blend of Luxury, Wellness & Heartfelt Hospitality

placeInfo/address: Pamunugama Rd, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka
text: This was our second visit to Jetwing Lagoon and it really is one of the best  places to unwind, de-stress and detox. The property is spacious, quiet and serene and the lawn by the lagoon is a great space to chill. The rooms are exceptionally large and very comfortable (we were in a luxury room in the ground floor overlooking the lagoon). The menu incorporates both healthy and regular options and all the dishes we tried were delicious and beautifully presented. It was especially  nice to see a lot of imaginative fusion dishes incorporating local ingredients (especially recommend the Negombo Coconut Cake and the woodapple smoothie). But the most impressive thing about the hotel (as always) was the outstanding staff. The service is really top-notch. My parents are elderly and therefore have some mobility challenges and specific dietary needs. The restaurant team (Aruna, Imashi, Ranmini, Nadeesha and Pasindu) went the extra mile to make sure that all their needs were fulfilled and that they had an enjoyable stay. Their genuine kindness and attentiveness made my parents feel truly welcomed and at ease. A warm thank-you also to the amiable Ravindu from Housekeeping for his warm and efficient service and for taking such good care of us all! His thoughtful care left a lasting impression on our stay and is much appreciated. The spa is well-appointed and our therapists Nuwan, Mahel and Insam were clearly skilled and well-trained. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Thank you Jetwing Lagoon for another wonderful stay! We are looking forward to coming back.
title: Great property, delicious food and wonderful service!

placeInfo/address: Pamunugama Rd, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka
text: Our family had a truly relaxing stay at Jetwing Lagoon Luxury Wellness Resort. One of the highlights was the amazing foot massage we received from talented therapists, Insam and Nuwan, so calming and professionally done. We felt completely refreshed after the session. A beautiful place with wonderful staff. Highly recommended for a peaceful getaway!
title: Foot Massage Therapy at Jetwing Lagoon - Wellness Resort

placeInfo/address: Pamunugama Rd, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka
text: Wir hatten uns für zwei Tage / eine Nacht vor dem Abflug hier eingebucht. Das Hotel liegt etwas außerhalb, dafür idyllisch an der Lagune und eine Straßenüberquerung vom Strand entfernt. In der unmittelbaren Umgebung war jedoch nichts. Das Hotel ist schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen, aber sehr gut gepflegt. Mit seiner Farbgebung und seinem Stil wirkte es auf uns eher wie eine Reha- Klinik. Die Zimmer waren sehr groß, sauber und wirkten in ihrem Stil eher nüchtern. Vom Abendessen waren wir enttäuscht. Wir hatten uns für Kotelett entschieden. Dieses war sehr klein und mit hohem Fettanteil. Dazu gab es eine kleine Kartoffel. Es entsprach eher einer Vorspeise als einem Hauptgang. Das Frühstück bot eine große Auswahl vorwiegend auf asiatische Gäste abgestimmt. Eierspeisen und z B. Hoppers wurden frisch auf Wunsch zubereitet. Wir buchten uns noch zwei Massagen und bekamen eine der übliche "Streichel- Wohlfühlmassagen" im guten Preisverhältnis. Das Personal war stets sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Für unseren Kurzaufenthalt ein entspannter Urlaubsausklang. Für einen längeren Aufenthalt würden wir hier jedoch nicht buchen. Dafür wirkte für uns die Anlage selbst zu nüchtern (Reha-Klinik-Flair), der Strandabschnitt weniger einladend und uns fehlte Gastronomie in unmittelbarer Nähe. Uber zum Flughafen klappte problemlos.
title: Für einen Kurzbesuch empfehlenswert
